reviews.text: Great riverside location for food and dinner cruise at reasonable prices. Now new location at Tha Din Dang.

Been to many dinner cruises on Chao Phraya river Bangkok. This is one of my favourite. It’s non luxurious nor pretentious. You pay ฿200 per person for the cruise and all the drinks and food are a-la-carte on menu. Very authentic Thai food and western food is available too. Reasonable priced. A bottle red wine ฿600-1,400. Steam whole sea bass ฿390, crab meat curry ฿160. New and big boat with totally open top deck, lots of tables and seats to choose. Not many tourists but quite popular with the locals. Note, there’s a Yok Yor restaurant 2 blocks away which is not the boarding place for cruise. Yok Yor Marina & Restaurant is the boarding place for dinner cruise. 
There’s a live band singing jazzy and soothing English, Thai and Chinese songs. Not like some other boats blasting with loud party music if you want some relaxing atmosphere.
Definitely will return whenever in Bangkok. :)
Good food and good service..

Yok Yor Marina & Restaurant (non buffet cruise)

I am of mixed reviews about the restaurants dinner cruise. My wife and i went there this evening with our 9 month daughter and my mother. We started with drinks in the restaurant while we waited to board the boat. The waitress was fantastic she was interacting with our daughter and looked after us really well however when we went to board the boat she was busy with another table the wait staff from the boat didnt come as assist us to board and we had to carry our own drinks, pram, baby bag onto the boat our selves. My wife had to ask the waiter watching us struggle to help carry the drinks.

My wife ordered a steamed rice for our daughter and when it arrived at the table it was cold and sick, the smell is that of rice that is off ข้าวบูด. We sent it back for a fresh serve. 

The food however yummy was let down by the wait staff. I am ashamed to say that out of all of the Asian countries I have visited this was the worst customer service that I have ever experienced. I was pouring my own drinks which I don't have an issue with however the table next to us was getting table service. We had to request to have the drinks refilled. the dirty dinner plates were left on the table and I carried the pram up the stairs and I attempted to carry it again down the stairs before the manager finally saw me and asked someone to assist me.

Food 4/5
Views 5/5
Customer service -2/5
Two hours dinner on boat, u must try the food with good taste and price reasonable

In 1897 King Rama V paid a royal visit to Europe visiting many of the royal palaces. Upon his return he land for the construction of a royal garden which he named "the Dusit Garden".[1][2] [3]

Vimanmek Palace was constructed in 1900 by having the Munthatu Rattanaroj Residence in Chuthathuj Rachathan at Ko Sichang, Chonburi, dismantled and reassembled in Dusit Garden. It was the first permanent residence in the garden. Nails were used during in its construction. The interior decoration combines European neo-classical style with traditional Thai motifs and architecture and early-20th century modernisation. Vimanmek Mansion follows Victorian Style that is an influence from Europe Architecture applied with Thai Architecture. The material that was used to build the entire mansion was golden teak. The shape of the mansion was alphabet L in English, 60 meters each long and 20 meter high. This mansion has three levels and the residence part is octagon shape and has four levels. The lowest level is made by brick and cement and all the upper levels are made by golden teak. The color of the roof is cream and red in Thai Architecture style and the pattern of the window and ventilator is called Kanom Pang Khing. Each room of the mansion has different colors, which are light blue, green, pink, ivory and peach, and each room shows belongings of King Rama V and other noblemen.

The celebration for the completion of the 72 room Vimanmek Palace was held on 27 March 1901. It was used as a royal palace by King Rama V for five years until the completion of Amphorn Sathan Residential Hall in 1906. In 1932, Vimanmek Palace was used only as a storage place of the Bureau of the Royal Household.[4]

In 1982 Queen Sirikit asked permission of King Rama IX on the occasion of the Royal Bicentennial Celebrations of Bangkok to renovate Vimanmek Palace for use as a museum to commemorate King Rama V by displaying his photographs, personal art and handicrafts, and to serve as a showcase of the Thai national heritage. The palace is now a major tourist attraction and is the world's largest golden teakwood mansion.[4] Many of the gifts and treasures that King Chulalongkorn collected on his European trip are now displayed in the museum.
Closed so don't waste your time coming here.
Unfortunately closed completly - no entance to the whole areal allowed! We planed a whole day trip especially to this attraction - but we went there to stand infront of the high walls...

I wish I could even endorse this one pitiful star. Negative five stars would be more fitting. We planned an entire day trip around these grounds. The ENTIRE AREA IS CLOSED and fenced off with massive walls so that nothing is even visible. Atrociously disappointing. Good luck.
It was one of the best places to visit in Bangkok when it was opened to the public.

We went to an event called Love and Warmth at Winter's End, which hold at the area. At the event we were allowed to take as many (of our own) pictures as we liked. There were many food stalls and shops decorated in traditional Thai style and many volunteers cleaning and helping at the event. People were super helpful and kind to each other. We had so much fun there. It was a wonderful family time.

Although this statue is in Bangkok, the style was influenced by the Europeans. Pretty great location. You can take a picture of both the statue and the palace behind. Highly recommended. Fun fact, the leftover money from building this statue was used to establish Thailand's first westernized university--Chulalongkorn University.
People comes to pray this king the great especially on Tuesday night. There are free pink roses as king favorite, and incense

KING RAMA5 STATUE 
FOR SPIRIT AND GOOD THINGS
I was there for a fair.  Not sure what its like when the prmeople leave.  Surrounding buildings are beautiful.  Great photo ops there

Very beautiful and lots to see. There is a small museum that has lots of cool Thai statues and coins. The Buddha its self is massive! Might have to get on your knees to get the whole statue in the frame. You can wear shorts but will need to wear a t shirt.

A nice temple with a beautiful wax figure monk meditating in an air conditioning room..... Which one can just sit n relax.... Free flow of holy water available to drink n there's a small museum with very old statue

A standing Buddha statue at this temple is one of most remarkable landmarks in Bangkok. The temple fair, held annually, is a great combination of traditional Buddhist ceremonies and local entertainment in one place. A must visit for all foreign visitors and the locals alike.

Most famous for its historic 32-metre high standing Buddha statue, this temple of great reverence is a must-visit attraction when you visit Bangkok. It really reflects the unique Thai Buddhist culture. The ornate Buddha image house is absolutely breathtaking and inspiring us and so is the huge Buddha statue. Entrance ticket is not expensive.

Thailand is full of Buddha’s status. This is one the tallest statues of Buddha in Thailand which is around 32 meters in hight. Our guide said it’s partly gold plated, before you enter you will see many Buddha’s status in the premises, artificial lotus ponds and Buddha as a kid . Temple has a gallery where you’ll se all the kings of Thailand, when our guide was descending the stories of those King his chin was proudly lifted.
One of my fav gallery. They have many awesome art collection and the owner as well as the staffs are so friendly. Thanks for good time.
It's not a big place, but good to host smaller exhibitions and art event. The exhibition I went was an incredible one. Go to their FB page to see what's happening.
Great artwork exhibition in small place even it's a little bit hard to reach there.
It's a one room gallery within a house. Very cozy and warm reception. Parking is only available on the street, though likely not a problem
One of Bangkok’s best galleries

Awesome Thai Cuisine restaurant with a variety of dishes. Their dishes are extremely delicious, especially crab curry (500 Baht), fried vegetable with roasted pork and green curry.The crab omelette is a little bit overrated but it is still good. Service is good, friendly & dishes were quick to arrive. Price is reasonable too; most of the dishes are around 100 baht.

Very rude waitress here! The one with lots of make-up on and light colored hair. She rolled her eyes and gave me a nasty look when I walked in. Then she slammed the menus down on the table and quickly walked away. When I was ready to order, I asked for the curry that was on the menu. She breathed really loudly in my face, shook her head "no" and walked away again. That was enough for me. I left and went to a nice restaurant across the street, where the people were super friendly. 

It's obvious that this woman either had a problem with westerners/tourists or maybe black people. I'm not sure and I do that care. Both would be pure ignorance. Don't waste your good energy going to this restaurant.

One of best meals I've had in Bangkok. The crab meat with curry powder was delicious, the Papaya Salad was one of the best I've had. Stir fried vegetables with crispy pork was outstanding and the Chicken Wings were delicious and crispy. Staff were friendly and air conditioning was excellent. Can't wait to go back to try more dishes

Very good - a nice change from the usual noodle and curry dishes. But portions were smaller than expected especially for the price. Total for all of the dishes with rice, fried tofu, and one tea was 1115 baht. Would recommend.

Oh and they actually made it medium medium spicy.
Even the royal Thai family dines here and I can see why.  Excellent authentic Thai and great value for money. Can recommend the crab meat curry.

A document of a more unknown part of Thai history, far away from the common image of "land of smile". Saddly the exhibition is written in Thai. But the pictures have been worth to watch them. For history interested people a good place.
Respectful peaceful memorial which inspired me to learn more about the uprising
So so, self service
Interesting landmark.

Whilst the monument itself is interesting to see, the documentation of the events in English are confined to newspaper articles on a notice board and are not well maintained. The Thai displays are much better, which I guess is more important for such a matter.

Its a good place to cool off the heat during afternoons and a place for recreation and relaxation. It also gives you a good view of the Phra Sumen Fort and the King Rama Bridge both day and night. It was also a good thing that we were able to experience a traditional and cultural fair there too.

+ Nice park by the river. 

- Annoyoing aerobics session at 6pm, the speaker is way too loud. 
- Motorcycles sometime rides at the side with no care for pedestrians. careful

I love to stay here. Quite place with beautiful harmony music. Sitting seeing Chao praya river, seeing people play with their puppy, or aerobic group. Place near soi rambuttri, park when we are want to take a Chao praya boat.
A nice park to sit and relax, and look out over the river.

I come often to this fort to read a book or just get some air.
Evenings there are aerobic instructors so you can dance with the ladies, let's burn that fat of the butt! 
Further the flowers of the tree are smell very delicious. 
The other day I released my boat with wishes from here at the celebration of Loi Thatum

Stone thrown distant from KaoSan road. Previous King was trained in this temple. Golden tower and many Buddha are in many small temples. You can see many Thailand people are very serious about their wishes and in many places, you have to take off your shoes.
a must-see temple, if you visit the area of banglumpoo, heart of Bangkok. a very old temple with Budha Images that are very ancient. The temple itself is quite peaceful, not so crowded.

One of the royal temples. Has Buddhist temple beside. Campus was really peaceful. People sat at a couple of places offering prayers. If you happen to have questions, staff are helpful. It's 5-10 minutes walking distance from khaosan road. Be mindful of wearing covered clothing (no shorts/sleeveless), this might offend someone.

just walk through and in and taste the serenity, mind the dress code and respect all. 
Buddha is not for decoration.

It's a nice temple, but nowhere near one of the nicest in Bangkok. Give it a miss if you are getting a bit "templed-out". Also BEWARE, there are HEAPS of scammers here who will tell you stories about cheap tuk-tuks, cheap tailoring, etc, tell you that the grand palace is closed and that they are government officials!

This restaurant needs your passport to protect the community center. Security guard comes from Ukraine. Mango fruit juice is so sweet , dishes is a little bit higher price than that of other neighboring stores.
Bit of yedishkit did not kill anyone, the people of the habad treat every one as a unique soul. Great hospitality
Food good but quiet pricey. Bring your Passport or a Copy otherwise you'll get refused by Security
Great place, prices, service,  kosher & friendly. Free computer service. Synagogue on premises with minyan. Get help with anything you need, & all with a smile.
Kosher food doesn't have to be borring and tastless.
That’s a street with a lot of die substance, nice joke. But your cancer not 🙃🌱

My first experience with food in Thailand 3 weeks early and now back and still the best! The stir fried curries are so nice and the staff also nice. I definitly recommend this place for every meal of the day!

Hostess and waiter had terrible customer service, the food portions are quite small and lack flavour. The street setting is nice but it could be cleaned. I would keep walking on by - so many more amazing places to eat than here

Good service and very good price wise. The toilets could be improved and also a general tidy up in the restaurant.
I only ever drink in bars at Khao San so I cannot comment on the food.  
Good for watching the world  go by
Taste of Food was okay, the staff was unfriendly and there was no atmosphere. Wouldn’t come back

Nice restaurant with cheap prices. 
Could be a nice place to have a drink by watching people passing by😊
good mix of food with life band
Un très bon restaurant qui n'a pas changé depuis 4/5 ans. Un très bel endroit pour passer une agréable soirée entre amis autour de délicieux plats Thai.
Warning! This place charges 10% service AND 7% Vat on top of the menu's stated prices, making it very poor value. View is nothing special. I would not come here again.

Ordered a coconut smoothie while waiting for the ferry. Big mistake, I was served a drink that looks nothing like a smoothie - it was a sugary liquid drink with coconut shavings that you had to chew before you swallow.  I took the drink back to the counter where they have a Vitamix blender and requested that the drink be blended more.  For this request, I was given dirty sour looks by the gal that was making the drinks, and said something in Thai underneath her breath (probably she was cursing me).  By the way, the drink tasted like sugar, nothing else. Nope no hint of rich coconut taste.
Called here for a light lunch after arriving via the ferry. Very friendly and helpful staff. Good food. Prices weren't out of the given where the restaurant is situated.

The food was pretty flavorless and mediocre at best. It was quite pricey to the Bangkok standard as well. The service was unassuming, but slow and inattentive. However, the view of the Chao Phraya from the outside dining area on the balcony was exceptional.
Only had few drinks here. Just came for the views. The view is amazing
Great variety and nice staff. Cool ambiance. My kids enjoyed feeding the fish. The items we ordered were delicious.
Reasonable prices and good food. Really enjoy eating here. I do without as much oil but overall great value
Interesting place. Cuisine is quite appetising. Would definitely visit them again
very quiet, service was ok great food
Food quality in accordance with the price. CHECK our change when paying or they may take their own tip.They did with us!

Excellent food! We enjoyed very much. Love the giant shrimp Tom yum soup. But our waitress took it away before we completely finished. The yellow chicken curry was very good also. And the vermicelli pork salad we also liked very much. Restroom is big and clean.  Will definitely come back again.

They have vegan friendly foo, taste amazing! Clean, full of energy! Sunlight! Lemon shake too! Great amazing vibe! Even the birds build nest here(in Chinese fun shui where the bird build a nest means gray vibe)! Definitely will be back again, price are decent! I leave tip for them!
P.S. don’t believe people especially from Korea or Asia who leave such common like”too expensive”(expensive is there problem not the price) “too hot”(they don’t know how to enjoy sunlight, “not friendly(they not friendly niether).
☀️

Go for the drinks, not the food. Although the curries are big, large enough for two people, they are also lacking some taste. Alcoholic drinks were nice but the coconut shake far too sugary. Atmosphere was good, in particular the singer when the live music started around 9pm (was a Friday).
I ordered the Tom Yum soup and it came out lukewarm, then I had to wait over 30 minutes for my chicken dish.  The food itself was fine, nothing special you can get better for cheaper nearby.
Very chilled friendly service go to the back of the restaurant and relax on the swings and have a drink in a relaxed atmosphere

Do not miss the Museum of Contemporary Art in Bangkok! Not only is it a wonderful museum it is also a stunning piece of modern architecture. You'll need all day and then some more, a dream for any art buff there's five floors of spectacular exhibits. On the ground floor there's a restaurant, garden and an interactive experience. Take the family.  I loved it and next time I'm in Bangkok I'll be heading back for another look.👍🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

The Museum of Contemporary Art is from 2012. It is a private museum housed in a large building. 

There is no double pricing. Same price for a Thai and a foreigner. If you  are more than 60, you can enter for free. Not only Thais, but also foreigners. The price for a regular ticket is TB 250.

Obviously, most of the items on display in this museum are from Thailand, but on the fifth floor there is an interesting collection of foreign items.

Next to all items on display is a label with information in Thai and in English. 

You are allowed to use a camera inside the museum, but you cannot use a flash. There is one exception: you are not allowed to take pictures inside the special Robert Green collection on the fifth floor.

There is a coffee shop on the ground floor. There is a car park in the basement. 

The staff are friendly and helpful.

If you are interested in contemporary art, this place is definitely worth a visit.

Oh....
This is an ....hard to say.
They declare that this is a contemporary museum but this museum does not explore the comprehensive contemporary art all over the world because it’s simply this is a private museum owned by one business man.the collection is rely on his taste.of course this museum is playing a key role for collecting national artists of Thailand but mainly the collection is reflected on his preference.
I really love this spot because I can enjoy the most sophisticated art works in Bangkok.
I’ll come back here again.

Great museum. 
Beautiful building. Lots of great surrealism and some traditional Thai art. 
Definitely worth going although it's hard to get to, since the nearby train is not operational yet. Try to make sure your cab driver knows the place. Took us some time to get there but was worth it 👍👍

Surprisingly beautiful (and modern) structure that houses mostly modern and some traditional art. Peacefully quiet—not many locals seem aware it exists. The art is fascinating—a modern reinterpreting traditional Thai aesthetic forms. Lovely reprieve from the hot chaos of the city.
Free entry.. Perhaps one of the very few interesting places in Ankara. You'll find all about Ataturk.. his pictures, life size wax statue and his grave. Must visit place!

The place as a poetic painting of every part in which a description of the championship and courage.The fragrant anniversary and long history of the heroes of this great country.You can feel the spirit of heroes and brave fighters and you wander around this great edifice.
I love it.

A magnificent complex perfectly encapsulating the importance of Atatürk as founder and shaper of the modern Republic of Turkey. This is definitely one of the foremost sights for any visitor to Ankara. Just remember that this is almost a sacred place for many Turks and so act especially respectful here.
After Traveling to ankara I felt in love with the city! Amazing! Best city in middle east! Specially Young people are great in Turkey. Love it

Minimalistic monument, nice to see. When we visited it was snowing heavily so it wasn’t so easy to approach cause the stairs were frozen and it was slippery. Besides the weather conditions, there aren’t many signs so we didn’t even realise there was also a museum and not just the monument so we missed that part which I later heard was the best part :/ And the securities on the entrance were really nice and friendly.

The best Wat in the city. Quiet and lack of tourist crowd, and the gold color really pops out with the sun shining, especially in your camera! Pretty easy to find, Google Maps will definitely take you here just fine.
The best temple in bangkok. There is just a few tourists, its free, and its unique! Highly recomend

This temple was up there in my list of favorites because it was the quietest. Since tourism is huge, it can be hard to find Instagrammable places in Bangkok without any people photobombing your shot. Plus, it’s nice to experience the serenity of a temple in the way it was meant to – rather than the chaos of tourists.
Very calming and relaxing. Worth visiting and peaceful walk around this school. You are also welcome to meditate. Entrance is free.
This is not the Wat Ratchanaddaram . It is a school. The  Wat Ratchanaddaram is  the Wat behind King Rama III Memorial

This may be the most amazing temple in Bangkok. It is so majestic. The variety of things you see there is remarkable. All the bells and gongs that you can ring are wonderful. Active worship was taking place all around us and they broadcast the chants from the monks from speakers. When you get to the top, the views are priceless and the winds feel refreshing.

This was a very cool temple to visit. Well shaded on the way up. Plenty of activities and a beautiful service at the top. You don't have to be a Buddhist to enjoy the beauty and feeling of community when you visit. The coffee shop half way up also is reasonably priced and very comfy.

One of my favorite temples in Bangkok. The hike up to the temple was not too bad and there is a little shop that serves very nice beverages. The temple is naturally cool and is a nice place to get away from the heat. There are multiple ways to hike down each is scenic in its own way.

It's good place to see the aerial view of city. Bottom of this small hill is nicely decorated with waterflows and eye catching images.

This is build on the graveyard. There were 60000 plague victims all dead and hurried in this place.

There are two big temples nearby with good architecture. There is also ship yard very nearby to this monument. It's good to enjoy the ship ride to different places of the city.

There is parking place inside the compound of this temple for both two wheeler and four wheelers.

Great temple for the religious type. For the non-religious, there are several interesting historical artifacts such as the museum of Buddhism scripts and a replica of the Banyan Buddha statue. There is also a fortune telling station that you shake a shaker until a numbered stick comes out. Based on the numb er on the stick, you retrieve a leaflet with that number and on it you can read your fortune in best future, typical regarded as can happen within a year. Seems very popular with young girls. My prediction is that love got something to do with it.
An easy stop in the old Bangkok with historic residence of Thailand's number one poet, Sunthorn Phu

This temple has its unique Chinese porcelain roof which differs from most of its surrounding temples with traditional Thai gable roof.  The significance of this temple is described in my temple introduction sign photo.  The reason I was here is simply because my wife was in the long queue of near-by Thipsamai Pad Thai restaurant and I took advantage of wandering around.

Small complex housing 3 different sites. Among them is the Sunthon Pho Museum, Thailand's most famous poet. Brilliant and creative storyteller, using the European influences of the time as inspiration for many of his stories.
Nice place
If you would like to know more about Thai history and about Buddhist, this is a good choice. Ticket cheap. The monks have lots of interesting stories to tell.

Very friendly and welcoming staff.
Two routes (of 2h each) are possible to discover the different themed rooms (culture, vision, relation to the king, ...)
The visit of the museum can only be done via those routes at fixed times. (Every hour or two)
Guides will escort you through the museum rooms and provide explanations in Thai and English. An audio-guide is provided for a live translation in English of the displayed videos.
Unfortunately the visit is restrained by the guides rhythm, too fast.
We didn't have the time to watch or read all the contents.
Although a lot of efforts have been put to create such a rich museum, it was hard for English speakers to understand everything. Staff would deserve more training. Speeches sounded like read from a book. At some point I would have prefer to have the time to read the signs by myself.

For a more interactive/fun visit, I would recommend route #2.

A wonderful exhibition cum museum which displays the history of Bangkok and The Thai Monarchy with great finesse. Perfect use of technology to convey desired meaning. 
A good place to visit if you are interested in learning more about Thailand, Thai people and their history.

Very informative and they offer English audio headsets so you may follow what is going on. Route 2 involves the brief history of Thai life over the last 300 years. You are then lead to a thorough showcase of each of the last 10 Kings of Thailand. Worth checking out for a culture trip!
Anybody want to knows about thai history this is the best place.... There the best place to know the details about thai culture also.. Good hospitality in this exhibition staff...

The tours of Bangkok history are fairly interesting, though the English was often very hard to understand. Also, there are interactive areas which you are not given enough time to explore and there are several quite boring parts that you are forced to.sit through. It would be much better if they allowed you to walk around at your own pace.
I recommend you save half a day and look at Wikipedia and YouTube instead.

Very witty, informative and fun exhibition dealing with the question What is Thainess?.  Every room covers a different topic - history, food, clothing, culture, everyday objects - with plenty of interactive options.  Cool airy corridors, clean bathrooms and nice gift shop with some unusual souvenirs.  Highly recommended, especially for a family with older children 8+.

Great exposition of history of Thailand. I think, that every one, should have to visit it to understand his history and his  mentality. The presentation is very good prepared with light humor of his self. You can get the audioguide at reception for better experience. The entrance and all services are free of charge. ☺️☺️☺️

Best museum I've ever visited. Entry fee is 200 Baht, audio Guide is for free. Every room is interactive in a unique way. No matter if you go in alone or in a group you can have fun. Theme is: what is Thai(ness) and how did it become like that? I came with no expectations and went out with an overwhelmed feeling. Staff is extremely nice, restrooms are perfectly clean. Extraordinary.

Love this museum so much. There are  creative contents about Thai historical stuffs. The children enjoy playing toys and  games together with learning new experiences. Moreover, they learn that Thai history is more interesting than only in their books. The museum provides them a chance to try and touch the real ones.

Out of our expectation, it was a fun and entertaining experience in a museum. As you can see from the pictures, there are not only exhibits of things in Thailand, but also games and activities that visitors can participate in to get a deeper understanding of the question - what makes Thailand 'Thai'?
It's definitely worth your visit.

Very small museum, cool knowledgeable guides that seem to master a lot of the countrie's historic, traditional and mythological stories. In an hour you can see most part of it. There is a little shop outside of the museum where you can buy some artifacts that are also available elsewhere at lesser price.
I like this place but I would love it if it had enough traditional and local object. I think it doesn't represent enough the national heritage

I loved visiting this museum. I wish I could've taken pictures. Nevertheless, our tour guide, William Dayo, was very well versed in each of the exhibits. It was really nice to have someone with us who gave us in depth information on what we were viewing. It gave us a deeper understanding and appreciation for each of the artifacts.
It was nice. The museum has a lot to offer in cultural history and I was happy to see them opened on a Sunday.

This museum continues the tradition of equating Western African culture and history mainly with masks (sarcasm). It could almost be interchangeable with the museum's in Dakar and Bamako except they both have a second floor dedicated to textiles. 

Granted, the masks are interesting and high quality, but they are completely decontextualized with cryptic captions an little explanation tying anything together.

There is one table showing the evolution of money that was nice. 

It's one of the few times I wished there was a museum gift shop with some books. 

Weirdly they don't allow photography either, as if history should be hidden. 

Avoid the restaurant out back it is way overpriced and there are better maquis around.

The work room of the Father of Thai Modern Art. He made nearly all of the monumental sculptures in Thailand. Nearby is the Hall of Sculptures which contains all of his sculptures. You can also walk around the campus galleries to see some of the students, faculty, and alumni work.
Silpa Bhirasri museum
Must visit.
관람객이 없도 전시 공간도 너무 작아서 아쉬웠다. 유명한 조각가라고 하던데 전시 규모가 너무 작다. 무료였고 직원분들이 친절하시다.

古くてこじんまりした美術館。
タイ近代美術の父・シン・ピーラシーの功績及び
彼の彫刻作品について紹介されています。
ヤワラーには時間が止まっている様な場所が
しばしばありますが、ここもそんな感じがします。
For me, this is the best museum in Europe. So many fantastic works of art.
Don't waste your time. The gallery is almost empty. Go to the national museum.
Short and sweet narrative of Bangkok fine arts.
Great exhibition. Especially, Marsis great paintings.
Definitely worth a visit! Intriguing artwork, and I think I literally spent hours there.
Nice place to relax after walking around the area. You can find many opportunities to take photos of the river, the boats and the temples.
Sit on the grass and starring at the starts at night when weather is nice, coffee shops are nearby.

Amazing sunset
The trees are lighten up with colorful lights at night
Bangkok the ancient city always welcome you.
Stroll along the riverside.

When I'm come here at Monday evening, it's closing. I'm coming again at morning Tuesday morning it's also close. I really want to stay in there. The park enough big and have a beautiful view. In here you can catch bus 04 to Don Mueang airport.

Too many people.
We went at 8.30am and there was a big queue. 
The place is really nice. You'll need some bottles of water.

Culture site in near Bangkok, Thailand...
So many cultural place you can visit in this area. 
One of tourist favourite spot to visit.

Visit here on the day of celebration of the new King of Thai.
Mass gathering of people to show support to the new King.
Very great moment to be here too during my trip in Bangkok.
Much more activities related to this celebration & parade.
Thai people very much respect to their King, really appreciate their cultures.
Long Live Thai King ...... 👍👍👍

This memorial for the died king Bhumibol just opened in November 2017 for public. It is phenomenal, amazing, gorgeous, haven't any words for that. I really recommend a visit there! It is beautiful and fascinating.
There is an exhibition about the buildings and the planning of them. Also it is shown how the statues are made and painted. You can get a look behind the scenes and the creation of a Thai temple.

I found this place a Historical place with the faith of Thai people. I also did one ritual on the first day of the year while other Thai public was doing. Ritual was like, we have to tie a three cloathing of different Colors for luck. Really very happy to do this with my family.
Smaller and a lot less touristy that Wat Po, but still worth visiting. They have live dance performances which are worth watching, if only for the interesting musical instruments.
Who like to pray and got success let I am introduce here
Small temple where you can see people practicing. Please remember to be respectful and take off your shoes before entering certain parts.
Sacred place for local people to come and pay respect.
Historic fortress of Rattanakosin Island. There is now a small park next to it after the nearby community homes were demolished
Nice and clean park with a running tract and seats under large ancient trees.
An old fort with adjacent park that was just recently renovated. Nice quiet place for an evening walk.
It's a really small park with little else to see. Visit this place only if you are in the neighborhood or visiting Golden Mount Temple which is a short walk away.
Not much to it but worth a look if you're in the area. Definitely recommend doing some research on Wikipedia to tie it back to the history.
A certainly interesting place to visit in Bangkok
Just a monument.

อนุเสาวรีย์หมู สร้างขึ้นในปี พ.ศ. 2456 เมื่อสมเด็จพระศรีพัชรินทราบรมราชินีนาถ พระบรมราชชนนีพันปีหลวง มีพระชนมายุครบ 50 พรรษา ซึ่งพระองค์พระราชสมภพในปีกุน ในวันเฉลิมพระชนมายุของพระองค์ในปีนั้น สมเด็จฯ เจ้าฟ้ากรมพระยานริศรานุวัดติวงศ์ทรงร่วมกับพระยาพิพัฒน์โกษา (เศเลสติโน ซาเวียร์) และพระยาราชสงคราม (กร หงสกุล) ซึ่งเกิดปีเดียวกันกับพระองค์ ร่วมกันจัดสร้างสะพานปีกุน และ อนุสาวรีย์สหชาติขึ้น เพื่อเป็นอนุสรณ์ของพวกท่าน 
ปัจจุบันเป็นอนุเสาวรีย์ ที่คนเกิดปีกุนนิยมมาสักการะบูชากัน
ปีใหม่นี้2562 ปีหมูทองคำ ขอทุกท่านจงร่ำรวยเป็นอภิมหาเศรษฐีช่วยเหลือสนับสนุนงบ รพ.  แลพ้นจากสรรพทุกข์ สรรพโศก สรรพโรค สรรพภัย หากได้ทำบุญ  ทาน  ศีล  ภาวนาแล้วจงหลุดพ้นจากกรรมทั้งปวงเทอญ สาธุๆ..ครับ
ปีหมูทอง 2562 เฮงๆๆรวยๆๆกันทุกคนที่มาไหว้อนุสาวรีย์หมูทองนะคะ 13/01/2562

Well restored national theater of Athens. Two venues inside the same building, the old historic one, beautifully kept, and a smaller space for more experimental theater. Always top level theater performances of the National Theater. You just can't go wrong by attending a theater performances there. Always too quality level word, and totally not staid!!!

My favorite theater in Athens. The building is amazing and the time you spend there always with hight quality. The area is not that safe but it worth it. Take the metro and choose omonia metro station. It is like 2’ walking from there. Do not hesitate to take an outside photo and of course to enjoy any event, just to realize the unique feeling. Sometimes there are offers on the tickets.
Such a superb place to be. Great theatrical plays on the stage, historical building with modern commodities - stage, lights, new wing!
A great theater for great plays, always enjoyed when I visit
Theater always decent but sometimes excellent

reviews.author_name: นพดล แจ๋มอ้น

reviews.text:
This is one of the oldest places where Thai authentic milk made products and drinks are available. One can taste them once.
As Thai people take much ice, all drinks are served with ice, there are few drinks without ice but they also mixed with much of cold water ( like me, I don't like too much diluted drinks, unfortunately almost all drinks will be available much diluted with water if not ice).
Here we can get a concentrated chocolate drink which is similar to Milo ( one must try this, it's very tasty).
There are few bread and buns, one can try once.
Family friendly. Simply delicious thai styles fresh milk drink & toast. Healthy food or not but worth trying. Shop opens at 3 p.m. Recommended 3 - 7 p.m. after that queues are funny crowded.
Delicious custard. Classic was my favorite, and I while I don't usually eat these kinds of things, it was delicious on the bread.
The restaurant will always crowdy in weekend, the milk and bread taste were  average, not too delicious or not too bad. However, the price are above average.

Services  🌟🌟🌟
Food         🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟
Environment 🌟🌟🌟
Highly recommended  👍👍👍👍👍
Prices 💰💰💰💰

Just is the toast, it selling THB 20, I felt expensive,  but ... is worth, because yummy....ha ha  😅😅😅
Tasty but compare to other markets...prices are too high.

Certified by BMA for clean market. You can find Thai traditional khanoms and dishes here, whereas prices are varied. I will definitely take my sister's family from Hong Kong to search for delicious khanoms and have lunch here.
Be prepared to eat to fully enjoy experience here. Too cramped for most photos other than selfies with the food.

Very affordable food market with lot of choices of food available, order to cook also available. Open area arena with plenty of public tables, soft drinks available of your choice for food. Simple place for great value.

Nang Leong Market is just a 15 walk from The Golden Mount. This is a local market with everything from buns, noodle bowls, curries, and a variety of desserts and drinks. Local prices with noodle bowls at 40 to 50 bhat. We ate until we couldn't eat anymore!

Overall just a great experience. The Building is located in the center of the city which is very convenient. It is nine floors of exhibitions and shops, with some pretty cool things to buy. They also have some artists doing paintings on the spot and you can get self portraits done. they have lockers where you can store your belongings while you walk around which is also a nice addition. I was quite surprised by the mixture of things they have to offer. Even though I wasn’t a huge fan of any of the styles of art that day, I can imagine that they have rotating galleries and it’s a personal preference kind of thing. I still enjoyed my time there very much and it was the perfect place for a family outing.

Very nice centre not only to discover art and culture through exhibitions but through directly buying from local artists from the kiosks scattered all around. You can also eat and drink and different outlets in the different floors of the centre. The ground floor have a very nice Thai specialty coffee for coffee lovers. The second floor have a small restaurant with very delicious food and cheap price.This is a seriously weak city gallery. I'd expect a mega city like Bangkok to have some really provocative exhibitions in this space but instead find something that feels like a vanity project. The building is reminiscent of the Guggenheim in New York with the long corkscrewing ramps around a large open space. But where the Guggenheim has art on every level and antechamber galleries hanging off it, this gallery just leads you up to two large rooms at the top. When I went there was some stuff shot on a mobile phone, a mismatched photo collection and a very obtuse collection of writings that honoured other South East Asian countries. There was one nice exhibit called perspectives which had some playful photos in it. I left with the impression that for the size of the gallery & its importance in the city it should have been something much, much better.This place is a great place to spend relaxing, drinking coffee, looking at art and maybe shopping for a bit. The first floor is where the good coffee shops are that serve a nice pour over coffee, while the top floors have nice art exhibitions, and the middle floors  have some art shops mixed in between some small art exhibitions. I would definitely recommend this place if you live in the city, or are just visiting looking for something nice to  do.

Art keeps changing Every month or so. Its a good place to visit for art lovers. There isn't any entry fees here. A good place to spend some quality time. Would recommend this to everyone. A lot of stores to buy artsy stuff.

BACC is located near a complex of shopping malls and has several floors featuring the work of emerging artists. The artwork is great, the space itself is beautiful, and the small shops inside are also interesting. Best of all, it’s free admission! Definitely check it out if you’re in the area.

Amazing! Enjoyed the photos and the exhibits. what i loved the most was the天天向上(meaning wishing for the better every day) exhibit. some exhibits were simply funny and some others envoked many thoughts. Truly inspirational and empowering.

We went early in the morning and arrived at opening time to beat the heat. We waited for about 25 minutes for our tour to begin. The tour was offered in English, French, Thai, Japanese, and Chinese languages by a guide who is well versed in the history of the property and Jim Thomson, the entrepreneur. Our tour guide was Mary who spoke very excellent English. For the tour, we were led first through the garden and then through the house where each area was explained in detail. Mary did a good job of keeping the group engaged with questions for everyone the about the artifacts found in the rooms. Although there are no photos allowed within the house itself, you can take photos on the grounds outside the house and your ticket gets you entry into a tour group throughout the day. Lots of interesting history here and a collection of ancient artifacts that Jim Thompson rescued from being smuggled out of Thailand. Because of the ancient artifacts and the efforts to preserve this historical site, you are required to leave your bags in a secured locker area free of charge and touching the artifacts within the house is not allowed. On the grounds there was a live demonstration on how the silk worm cocoons are first boiled and then ‘spun’ into silk threads using traditional methods before they are dyed into brilliant colors. There is a bookshop where you can find your astrological horoscope and an interesting book on the disappearance of Mr. Thompson which speculated that he may have been a CIA agent for the United States. Be aware that the gardens have mosquitoes within them but we were not bothered by them in the other areas of the museum grounds.

To be honest I never heard of Jim Thompson or his house but it was recommended so we went
The gardens are lovely and the house is nice. The tour is very good and give you an insight in to how he was. The tour does not talk much about the silk making process or industry. There is a person making silk in the court yard. Over all I would take people over 30 here to relax and stroll around an interesting house and garden.
Younger people I would recommend walking around the area and crossing the river to old Town and see how the silk is made there

I love this place! It’s so full of Thai traditional arts and the tour was amazing. The tour guide really helped us understand the architecture. And the owner’s disappearance sure adds a mystery to this beautiful place. The cafe/ restaurant upstairs has a really fine view, and the store offers a variety of beautiful silk! Love this place, would visit again next time in Thailand.

Interesting story of an American coming to Thailand in the 1940's and helping to revive the Thai silk industry and then his mysterious disappearance. His home and the grounds are beautiful, quiet and serene. There are high quality products available for sale as well, mostly silk, although it was not clear if they're made on site anymore. Also he had quite a collection of Buddhist artifacts, and many Asian documents and art pieces. Lovely way to spend an afternoon!

House owned by a multinational company (like Jimmy Buffet’s Margaritaville). Beautiful young female employees follow a tight script as they guide you through the house and garden. You don’t learn much about expat life or Thailand. It is a quiet respite from the noise of Bangkok … but a good hotel bar will provide that plus alcohol! If you go, jump on the water taxi at the end of the street for a fun adventure.

Minus one star for being open-air (self opinion). Myself just prefers air-conditioned. Except that, this is the best food mall I ever know. It is ranged from fair class food to medium-high. So that is suit for every age range.

Dude I love this Shopping Mall this is really great and has a lot of things to see. At the source surrounded by several other Shopping Malls where you can find everything. It is definitely worth it if you spent time in bkk

Locating next to Siam BTS. The place is full of eateries. They have Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai etc kind of food serving restaurants. If you want to eat something it is the correct place for you. Besides the mall also has section for fashion on the lower level. Behind the mall is another walking area where you might find an interesting place to eat and stores you might want to take a look into. It's a good place to explore at night.

Good enough place, i would however recommend that a center with such a huge turn over could afford more bins, and possibly a more interesting variety than the same old stuff found at every other shopping center. Other than that, it looks good, has some interesting things for sale.

On the other side of Siam Paragon in Bangkok, Siam Square One is another shopping mall. It serves many local restaurants as well as international cuisine. The Line Village shop is also located in this mall.

So many food options representing various types of cuisines, great place to eat as the aesthetics are particularly pleasing as well.
There are various food with reasonsble price, clean and taste good.
There are many foods. Not Expensive.
Taste is ok but  bit overpriced
Be careful. I went 2 times and got food poisoning both times. Not clean good

Such an amazing place to visit. Go get a card from the cashier and put you money onto it. Choose your food from several different places, lots of variety and lots all great. Well cooked, fresh and amazing flavours. Don't forget to go and take your card back and get any unspent cash back at the end of your visit!
Crispy pork here is bomb. The meat melts like butter in your mouth, yet still retaining the crispy skin. I was surprised that I enjoy this crispy pork more than the ones found on local street food.

If your group is split on what you want to eat definitely go to this place. There are a ton of options and you can pick and choose what you want.

The prices are beyond reasonable. The food is fresh and good quality. There is thai food, seafood, middle eastern, American and desserts.

Awesome local and overseas food available. There's plenty of options to consider. It's a concept of food court which is very good to have in a shopping mall. However other than pictures, might be good to have more descriptions in English.

Here’s something for everyone... you buy a card and then like in a canteen you choose a counter that’s food suits you, order and find a table... nice with groups for lunch. We had shrimps, dumplings, oyster omelette - everything was good.
Good Taste, Reasonable Price, Clean Place and there are 2 business meeting room on 3rd Floor
Very reasonble price, nice tatse, clean place with service-minded staff and there are two full-equiped business meeting room on 3rd floor.

reviews.author_name: นุสรา ขุนรายา

reviews.text: Minus one star for being open-air (self opinion). Myself just prefers air-conditioned. Except that, this is the best food mall I ever know. It is ranged from fair class food to medium-high. So that is suit for every age range.

Dude I love this Shopping Mall this is really great and has a lot of things to see. At the source surrounded by several other Shopping Malls where you can find everything. It is definitely worth it if you spent time in bkk

Locating next to Siam BTS. The place is full of eateries. They have Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai etc kind of food serving restaurants. If you want to eat something it is the correct place for you. Besides the mall also has section for fashion on the lower level. Behind the mall is another walking area where you might find an interesting place to eat and stores you might want to take a look into. It's a good place to explore at night.

Good enough place, i would however recommend that a center with such a huge turn over could afford more bins, and possibly a more interesting variety than the same old stuff found at every other shopping center. Other than that, it looks good, has some interesting things for sale.

On the other side of Siam Paragon in Bangkok, Siam Square One is another shopping mall. It serves many local restaurants as well as international cuisine. The Line Village shop is also located in this mall.

This place has some of the worst customer service in Bangkok.  It took over 15min for someone to come by the table, after i waved them down.  We ordered an appetizer and two main dishes.   The appetizer and one of the main courses arrived at the table and after waiting another 15 mins, i had to ask someone where my Burger was.  They went to the burger station and it was just sitting there.  The meat on the burger was under cooked almost "blue"

This place promotes itself as a green restaurant and they care about the single serve plastic usage.  BUT they do not serve water without a bottle. (you cannot order a glass of water)  They place napkins asking a bunch of questions (see attached) but they do not bother asking you or give you a pen to mark them off.  Not only that..but i was given two straws..

Expensive for what it is. I understand the restaurant set itself to be high end cafe but food was a big disappointment. The quality of meat served on dishes was low quality, tough and chewy. Only good thing is the presentation of the food and drinks.
Must-visit in Bangkok. Love the fusion Thai food here. Cosy ambience.
Extremely nice Italian / Thai fusion restaurant.
Good food and quick service. They have a wide variety of foods and drinks to choose from. I got the crab cannelloni and it was excellent albeit small.

I joined my friend for a meal on Sunday morning. He enjoyed a plate of linguine with pancetta and bacon, I enjoyed coffee and bread with the most delicious olive oil. The service was friendly and quick. The bite of his food I had enjoyed was good, but nothing to rave about. It lacked a bit of flavor. The menu seemed slightly pricey considering, but then again, it seems as though the restaurant has a lot of potential for good food.

Just have a birthday dinner here. Coincidental selection as waiting for better traffic.

Very impressive meal here. Service also superior. Today the restaurant manager ‘Jim’ took care of us by herself. She is very nice and superior service-mind.

and yes...birthday pecan cake is very nice :)

Love having dinner here. Surely coming back again.

I found the place via Google Maps and wanted to try it because of the good reviews. It didn't disappoint! The food was plenty and on point. Fast and friendly service, especially from the manager Jim. Prices are in a good range and you most certainly get your value. If you like different Mexican food I'd definitely recommend to eat here.

Helpful staff speaking like a native speaker. We never knew about Mexican food options other than nachos before this. They recommended food and presentation was neat and mouth watering. Go for a treat with free chips and yummy sauces. I love their selection of location and friendliness. Their waiter Mark is an awesome singer if you're lucky enough to convince him for singing a song ^^

Terrific as Always. Jim and her staff were friendly and helpful, which was nothing new to me. This is one of the most service oriented restaurants I’ve visited. I am always treated well, every time I come here. The only problem I have is deciding what I want to eat from all the delicious choices.

Great food ! Long time Mexican favorite in the area. New menu, pay attention here ! Ask for details. My kids did not obviously as they ordered for takeaway from Terminal 21 site and were a bit disappointed with their choice. Owner Greg attentive to feedback which is nice too. Will go back and already recommended to visitors.

Our regular hotel when staying in Bangkok, it has rarely disappointed us through our 10+ stays.
Staff is polite and service minded, front desk is usually quick and rooms are nice and, compared to many European hotels, quite spacious.
Big thanks to Suparp and the rest of the guys that greet us when arriving and help with our luggage. Always polite, smiling and service minded.
Breakfast restaurant is good with a huge variety of food, although I prefer to go outside for the local Bangkok taste!

The location is wonderful, right in the city center. Service is good, the staffs are quite helpful. Nice and clean, although a bit small.

Restaurants available everywhere and close to multiple malls like Siam center, Siam Paragon, MBK. The shopping mega Platinum is also just one station away, or if you don't mind the walk, there's a free walkway that takes you nearby as well.

فندق جميل وعجيب من الخدمه الي السكن في الغراف. وحتي الموظفين محترمين وطيبين وحتي الفندق قريب من المول سيام بركون 
Nice hotel! Great, convenient location. The check in staff were really friendly and helpful. I arrived early but Pump managed to find a room with no fuss and no waiting. Thank you!!
Great staff and service.  Good breakfast with variety. Close to everything.  Would stay here again.  Has a pool and a small gym.  Add pa as well.

This hotel wasn't really that nice. The only upside was its location within walking distance of shopping malls, restaurants, street sellers and markets, massages and salons. Personally won't go back as I didn't feel that comfortable there. Made use of the spa for a for massage which was pretty good.

Minus one star for being open-air (self opinion). Myself just prefers air-conditioned. Except that, this is the best food mall I ever know. It is ranged from fair class food to medium-high. So that is suit for every age range.

Besides the mall also has section for fashion on the lower level. Behind the mall is another walking area where you might find an interesting place to eat and stores you might want to take a look into. It's a good place to explore at night.
