Great staff and service.  Good breakfast with variety. Close to everything.  Would stay here again.  Has a pool and a small gym.  Add pa as well.

This hotel wasn't really that nice. The only upside was its location within walking distance of shopping malls, restaurants, street sellers and markets, massages and salons. Personally won't go back as I didn't feel that comfortable there. Made use of the spa for a for massage which was pretty good.

It's a beautiful, serene park a lovely place to have a peaceful stroll or a jog or a quiet lie-down under dense tall shade trees over well-maintained large lush green grass or to have some quality time either with friends or family. It promises fantastic vistas and ambiance with many varieties of landscapes that can't be described and need to be personally seen and felt, like tucking along a beautiful lake in its embrace having boating facilities as well and many other family-oriented activities. In all, we loved our little time over there, and it made Bangkok furthermore beautiful. Thank You, Bangkok for giving us such an amazing experience.

Great breath of fresh air in a busy city. There are a few gyms both outdoor and indoor here as well. It’s also much cheaper to go them rather than other gyms nearby. Also a great place to go running and relax with a book. Plenty of shade too for those 360 hot days of the year.

Its very nice place to visit... Lumphini park is well maintained...Park consists of the large area... Sometimes you will find huge 🦎 lizard in the park... People come here for jogging , cycling, exercise etc.. Park is accommodate with green lawns and trees... There is small lake in Lumphini park where people comes to rent the boats and have fun... So overall park is very amazing and attractive...I can't think of giving less than five rating for Lumphini park... Its really good...

A lovely, large area in the city for a stroll, jog, cycle, rent a boat or chill. Lovely lake and large trees. Quiet, until the loud aerobics music starts late afternoon. A good variety of outdoor exercise machines and a gym under the trees.  Very clean and well tended.

Lumphini Park is a 360 rai (57.6-hectare) park in Bangkok, Thailand. The park offers rare open public space, trees, and playgrounds in the Thai capital and contains an artificial lake where visitors can rent boats. Paths around the park totalling approximately 2.5 km in length are a popular area for morning and evening joggers. Officially, cycling is only permitted during the day between the times of 10:00 to 15:00. There is a smoking ban throughout the park. Dogs are not allowed.

If you're in Thailand and looking for Sunday worship. This is a great English speaking Anglican Church. Services are Sunday morning 7am and 10:00 am English worship. 1:00 pm. Thai whorship service. They have Sunday school for the kids. Potluck lunches after the service to meet and greet.
Nice playgroup on Wednesdays and Fridays. The pastor is very kind and we enjoyed the Sunday service on Easter.
Really moving experience-great interaction with sooo many cultures.
The Christmas morning service was lively and awesome.  There are washrooms (even for the disabled).
A true reflection of God's people a place of worship with dignity I love this church for all people come and be blessed

Built in 1879, this is one of the oldest Hindu temple in Bangkok. It was a very pleasant experience to visit the temple. We could see the culture mixing as well as people. 
The priest as well as all temple staff were polite and the time spent there was very calm and refreshing.

Very good  for a spiritual charge .buy insence  and oil and give to the priests that give to the deity in side you get a glimpse  of her .my advice is make a offering and sit  to the side for a hour or two and feel the energy you will experience a clear and peaceful mind.
This place is so amazing. Structure is great. Must see to everyone.

This place is Hindu Temple,from wikipedia, is the main Hindu Temple in Bangkok.It is located across the street from Silom Soi 20. The temple has  Dravidian style temple. This place is famous in successful making a wish.

Felt so happy to have seen a temple in our Indian style...all the idols are beautifully crafted that we feel it's not just an idol...it's the real God before us!
Such a divinely atmosphere....feels like mini spiritual  India ! Must see!

Yanawa Temple is a temple with a long history with Thai people. Is another royal temple of Thailand The interior has beautiful historic sites and there are sacred things that Thai people respect You can travel easily by sky train To Saphan Taksin Station.
Cool temple complex with a huge junk boat and very old ubosot
Nice temple near river take a break from busy life for while sit quiet in this temple.
Large temple on riverfront near Saphan Taksin BTS. Some interesting buildings
The exhibition hall showcase all Buddhist artefact from all over the world. Must visit after visiting the shrine
Just above average quality photography. If this guy is the best photographer is thailand and Thailand deserves better
Nice little gallery.
Interesting place tucked away and you can miss it quite easily. Spent an hour looking at the exhibition.
Famous gallery of a famous and gifted photographer  : Manit Sriwanichpoom ! Amazing ! Youb must see
Fabulous exhibit upstairs on a group of itinerant Nepali people from the Tarai Plains.

Cosy and relaxing atmosphere of both the library and the cafe. The collection here comprises of rare and interesting books where they don’t usually available in a general bookstore. A non-member entrance is THB 100 on donation to the library.

This is an interesting place to visit. The library is open every day except Monday. There is a coffee shop, but at the moment (June 2018) it is under renovation. You can sit and read if you want. Non-members are asked to give a donation of TB 100. Only members can borrow a book and take it home. Most (perhaps all) books are in English.

We walked nearby and entered this cafe for breakfast. The food was below average. The price was above average. I asked if I could use my credit card (JCB), they said yes but eventually it did not work. The staff was not helpful and the whole bad experience was time consuming, including the long time that we waited for our meals.
Nice library, but with odor of dust from old books
Lovely Saturday readings for kids. Children's book collection is pretty wide.

Picturesque complex of ruins overgrown with vine and grass. The city is looking for a private investor, says the information sign, and plans to convert these buildings into a boutique hotel. Entry is now impossible, you can watch the buildings from the outside though. Famous Mandarin Oriental hotel and elongated historical Thai-style magazines in vicinity.
Historical building that outside is still nice. People are not allowed to go inside. Mostly destroyed due to the poor maintenance.
Old Customs House. Walk around the outside of the structure and get a glimpse of 19th century Bangkok.
Only see outside and bad smell around. Just take photo is okay.
Pretty run down, but at least it's still here. Can't go inside though. Better view from the river.
Love small hole in the wall places like this that get it right. Quick service. Very cheap. And absolutely amazing.

The hype is real. Let's lay it down - it's the best duck noodles you can easily access in Bangkok. The store has reportedly been open since over 100 years ago, and it's been featured in newspapers and magazines multiple times. This place is very well-known among locals, and many go to this place around lunch time - even busy office workers ... like me haha.

- Meals start at 50 baht per bowl, with some you'll want for at 90 baht.
- They serve dumplings and other appetizers
- Expect to wait for seats
- It's crowded and stuffy indoors
- Serve-your-own broth (chicken bouillon cube stuff, sadly)

But you can't complain about the food.

The best bbq duck rice and noodles I’ve had in Thailand. Super good price. You’ll probably need 2 dishes to get full. The other dishes such as dim sum were not good. Also be prepared to wait or sit beside someone. The place is tiny!

The hype is real. One of the best roasted duck I have tasted. Great food; I also liked the sausage topping, I dunno what it's called. Not recommended for babies with stroller/pram; the place is a bit small especially if there are plenty of customers.
Food is great, a friend took us there, food is amazing a must visit. We had the dry noodle wonton noodles, along with the soup based one. Roast pork is amazing!
Surprisingly great vegetarian food in a hole-in-the-wall place. Most authentic Thai vegetarian food I've had in my 9 day trip.

Good vegetarian n vegan option
They even have noodle soup
Tasty n reasonably priced
Authentic thai vegan food. Point at items to order. Lovely spicy food. Inexpensive. Popular with the locals.
Great vegetarian food for little money.
Affordable food, no one spoke English but things went smoothly, anyway. You choose either dine in or take away, and pick what you wanna eat. Good, edible food. Very basic.

reviews.author_name: พีรดนย์ ราษฏร์อาสา
ธนภัทร ผิวทอง

reviews.text: The Food is good specially "หบ่อ​ม่อ". The reaturant has a very nice retro atmosphere of 60-70 years ago. However we had a table which when sat, I could not move my legs much. The price is on the upper side but not too expensive if the quantity and quality are considered.

Really great place!
The food was excellent.
Prices are normal for Bangkok.

There are many tables and there was a lot of people eating here.

Bathroom was very clean.
They don't have wifi.

Classic and tasty Thai cuisine.
Various kinds of food to choose.
Recommend the mussel, fresh and large.

bad bad service....

one or two lady staffs gave unpleasant service: getting wrong order, giving wrong dish, no willing to change or compensate..., no service mind

Food ok for some menu/ too much adapted if you want real Thai food.

A bit pricy

It would have been nicer  without the mentioned lady staffs

Came here in a November afternoon. Place was clam n quiet. It was an old buiding with period decorations. Food was delicious in fusion Thai style and moderate priced. It will get 5 stars if the service was more attentive.Will definitely try to eat here again.

Fantastic place. Best tapas anywhere in the world. Amazing staff. Best food and drinks in Bangkok at an awesome price. Well done on all aspects of this fine established Restaurant and may you reign supreme for a long time.
Some good, some okay. Very limited choice of wine. About 30% rise in price from before. Check your bill.

The food here tastes decent but pretty oily. The portion for the happy hour is very small. It is not that cheap considering the size of the dishes. There was one small cicatricial on the floor which makes me wonder what's lurking in the upholstery. Convenient location though.
Fruity sangria...... Lovely tattie bravas and wonderful staff

Not many choice for Spanish Restaurant in Bangkok. However, this restaurant offer a great experience for Spanish Cuisine. You could enjoy Tapas Combo in happy hours from 5-7 pm with special price. The taste is good enough for the authentic Spanish cuisine.

Oh my - an awesome eating experience. One of the best meals I’ve had in Bangkok. Beautiful surroundings, stunning food (with excellent selection on the menu); superbly attentive staff  and very acceptable prices. 
Excellent in my humble opinion. I’ll definitely be returning here!

I used to dine at this place. However this time, besides all the wonderful dishes they served, the dessert of mango sticky rice came out cold as they kept the whole plate in the fridge.

The manager fixed it instantly, bringing me a new dish at per their standard. It might be done by accident. The other traditional Thais dishes were as delicious as usual.
Excellent traditional thai food. The service is really good. Recommedations: prawns in red gravy and tom yang goong soup!
Delicious authentic Thai food! I have never tasted anything so delicious before! Even the fried rice was simple but full of flavour! Yum!!!

It's a very nice Thai restaurant that I would like to go again or recommend my friends. The place is very comfortable and definitely relaxing. Staff are helpful and polite. Food is quite good and seems clean, at least I am dared to have raw shrimps there.

This little sanctuary is hiding in the busiest district of Bangkok. I was surprised with the liveliness of this restaurant. The lighting and ambient create the modern dining theme. Menu is well organized into 3 groups, vegetarian, poultry and meat. I did try both poultry and meat main dishes. Both of them are flawless. All of the dishes that we ordered are creative and well cooked. Service was also great, they can communicate well even in English. I gave 5 stars and definitely will come back.

We spotted this place a couple of years ago and kept saying we'd go... Anyway, finally got round to booking a table! Superb! We enjoyed a beautiful evening celebrating our anniversary. The food was absolutely beautiful.
The wine list looked good and the cocktails looked amazing (will have to return when I'm not pregnant, so I can indulge!)
I cannot recommend highly enough.

You can never go wrong at Eat Me. Open for 20 years, this place serves up the best tomahawk I’ve ever tasted. Worth every penny! The mixed clams are delicious and addictive and the beef tartare has a hint of Thai flavors that is so flavorsome. The staff are super friendly and so welcoming. Polo, the restaurant manager is the so awesome and welcomes you with the biggest smile! And don’t miss the bar, where Poo the bartender whips up some crazy Thai street food inspired drinks!

Lovely classic menu with an upmarket twist. Some unusual cocktails too.
Lovely environment and attentive staff.
Exciting and buzzy bar and restaurant. It’s not cheap but there are nuggets of value on a superb menu. Excellent staff , knowledgeable and attentive.

if you love Italian food, you shouldn't miss this one! this is a very famous Italian restaurant in Bangkok. their pasta is very good, their meat menu also nice. highly recommend to make reservation before you go.

Zanotti looks beautiful. If you need to host a business lunch this is a good place. Food is just OK both in taste and quantity. Service is good. The only highlight that I had was the cappuccino and the bread. Is a bit on the expensive side but you would expect that from a place like this.
The food was most excellent, but be prepared to pay for excellence.  Servers were courteous and ambience just right. Zanotti ended my day with the right touch. Would visit again!
Decent Italian restaurant! Even tho the tables were very close to each other. We can hear what people were saying lolll
One of the best Italian restaurants in Bangkok. Must try the Zanotti pizza. Pastas are great too.

This recent trip is our family’s second stay at Shangrila Bangkok. The first was awesome, which brought us back for our second. This stay has been comfortable and enjoying for my children, as well as my parents. Friendly and helpful staff at the lobby on our arrival. My 6 year old girl vomited after our taxi ride from the airport. A few female young staff were extremely helpful, quickly handing us towels and helped consoling my girl, and later offered her a drink. These staff were so fast and so helpful! We felt very warm at heart!!! Our balcony rooms were wonderful. And I must highly recommend the breakfast at next2. Superb variety, great food and very attentive service! We will definitely come back!

Thank you for the colleague who did the check in. Even our room booking was under staff rate, she was patient to introduce and solve our problem which was treating us as guest. Very helpful and kind.
Also, the Chi spa was excellent. I went to Thailand and tried different spa for many times. The therapist-Honey in Chi spa was even the best. Her warm smile made me felt welcomed at the beginning and the massage made me felt worth to pay. Thank you for the relaxing experience she gave to me.

This place has been around for a while now, and it's well-known among the locals - for good reason! It's a superb hotel, and the staff members are excellent. Our company reserved the conference hall for a half day and evening for a full company meeting, and everything went really well. The Chinese dinner they served was excellent! (Peking duck - very, very good.)

Really, there are no complaints about this place. It's an added bonus that the hotel is sitting right next to the Chaophraya River, and you can get great views from the hotel bar or even the pool deck.

Would be a great getaway place.

I would have loved to give it a 5 star because of its location and ambience but reducing a star for complexity of navigating between meeting rooms and Building wings. You can't help being lost. Having said that, staff are very helpful and show you the way and you reach your destination walking really long!

The staff were kind, and the food in the lounge was delicious.
Only thing to be improved is cleanliness of the table in the lounge. I could see the traces of the cups left in many places and a little bit sticky when I am touching on surface of the table. It seems they have not wiped the table clean after the customer left.

And the communication skill/ background information about hotel facility should be more improved. We asked if we could borrow ping-pong racket /ball to play table tennis near swimming pool (Depending on each hotel policy, we used to borrow the racket and ball before) however, the staff in Krungthep lobby told us that we have to purchase the racket and ball in Robinson shopping mall whereas we found that racket and ball were equipped beside on the table while taking a walk later.

A thoroughly superb park fantastically set up for runners and cyclists. There is a clear demarcation between the two groups, marked by relatively high brickwork. Cyclists tend to leave the inner track (closer to the enormous pond) to runners, although the ground markings - indicated in Thai, and English - give room for both. 
  However, the evening runners are just too wonderfully numerous, and they’ll use both lanes. The cyclists still have a superb and in parts similarly undulating track outside those proceeding on foot. Greenery - tall, broad trees, and delicately scented flowers, jasmine among them - and the expansive body of water give a very calming backdrop to a run here.
  There are distance markers, although these start near the southwest corner. The loop is around two kilometres, and there’s an entrance in the northeast corner, and another halfway along the southern stretch. A separate boardwalk and some benches provide some space if you just want to sit - without getting in the way of active people.
  Near the southwest corner, set back from the running and cycle tracks is a public gym setup. Really good here too, and a lot of pull-up bars. You’ll also find bicycle hire and cycle parking around Benchakiti Park.

Great park in the city center to get away. Offers a bike track, outdoor gym, a skateboard ramp, parking and a lake where you can rent a paddle boat. Unfortunately the running track is concrete and probably not great on the knees. Great for a nice evening stroll though recommend the wooden walkways along the lake. Closes at 9 pm.

A great park for running, biking, skating (yes, skating), strolling and picnicking. There are 2 playgrounds, each for younger and older kids. Exercise equipment is also available. There are toilets too at least in 2 different spots of the park. You can rent paddle boats and bikes in the park. Kids love watching the fish and turtles in the lake. The best time to visit would be early in the morning, before it gets too hot, or late afternoon.
An oasis in the city. Flowers and trees and a cool breeze on a hot day. I really appreciate that it's not as busy as Lumpini or some of the other parks in the city too. Perfect for a picnic!
I love walking and running in this park. I arrived early around 5:30am when it wasn't very busy. Water fountains and public toilets are available. Bring your own tissue paper.
Fascinating if this is what you are looking for - a shame there was nothing in English - needed a little care when I visited
タイの薬局の博物館ということで中に入ろうとしたらなぜか警備員にものすごい剣幕で追い出されました。もしかしたら祝日だったのかもしれません。

reviews.author_name: อรรถพล อุดมวนิช
reviews.text: พิพิธภัณฑ์เภสัชกรรม เป็นส่วนหนึ่งของเภสัชกรรมสมาคมแห่งประเทศไทย ในพระบรมราชูปถัมภ์

If you're lacking of imagination, come to this place where you can enjoying ton of books, toms and so many materials to inspire yourself. The fee is cheap and you can get free one day pass for AIS Serenade membership.

I have been a member for a couple of years. Great place to come and work. When you have some time to yourself, there are tens of thousands of books on art and design to browse through, or hang out on the roof top terraces. 
Very impressive organization and repurposing of this classic Bangkok building on the river.

Great big place with tons of awesome books. If you're a designer of any sort or if you just want a quiet place to read or work, this is an awesome place to check out. Costs 100 THB for entry if you're not a member.

It was a fantastic, amazing place for designer!!! If I have to recommend one place for designer, this will be my recommendation! They plan so well, and collect varies part of design, from product to fashion or even architecture! Also there is a floor of work shop you can use!
Casual place, you can look for some particular groceries here
A cozy place with good Japanese food with good amount and good price. Open until very late night. The great option for late night when others places closed.

The restaurant is a true ramen haven if you're happened to be big fan of authentic Japanese noodle. The environment and dinning tables are exactly what you see in traditional Japanese restaurant. Food price is more than reasonable for what is served in the bowl or on the plate! It has become my lunch place these days.
Ramen is mild taste but quite good and big amount for 2. Great location just right next to The Emporium!
Reasonable price with big portion. I like gyuza
Very good place. The price is amazing. Good quality ramen and gyoza. I ordered the miso ramen. It was very salty but that suited me as I had a hangover. Enjoy!

This place is a hidden gem! So yummy, the chef is talented! The real win here is the staff: Jennifer and Anne were amazing (I hope I remembered their names correctly)! I felt like I was being served dinner at one their homes. So warm and welcoming.
I love having a nice restaurant like this on Main Street in Weston. Thank you to whoever put in this gem. Great staff and great food.

Went here for a date with my girlfriend. The waitress, Olivia, was very friendly, down to earth, and professional. She answered all of our questions and gave us excellent recommendations. This place is definitely somewhere you could propose. Mood lighting, soft music, very romantic vibe. Prices were fantastic, portions were large. Loved it.
Absolutely awesome food prepared just for you. Amazing.

The food was delicious! My husband and I ordered the crab cakes for an appetizer, he ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and I ordered the Greek salad with salmon. The service was great and the atmosphere was wonderful too!

This is a nice casual restaurant with a good cause theme to promote family planning and HIV awareness with proceeds going to fund this. Food is reasonably priced for a restaurant in Bangkok with most mains being around 200 baht. Service is very good and the food tasted great. You can sit inside or outside in a lovely courtyard area lit with lanterns and fairy lights. There is also traditional live thai music playing in the background which i thought was recorded until i looked around and saw the lady playing. Well worth going for a meal and supporting a good cause.

What makes the place unique is that it is a restaurant with a cause. It seems funny that they give away condoms but it is because they want to promote safe sex. Food is good. Less one star because they don't give service water.

This little quirky place is amazing. The food and service was great and their work is great too. They help with sexual education and other causes which is amazing. Highly recommended going. They have a decent sized gift shop too.

Nice concept of this restaurant, i can said it is unique. Really famous for tourist and foreigner. It serve the Thai Traditional Food. The environment is cozy. And as the name, condom will give after end of eating.

Funny little theme restaurant that does great work for sex ed and other charitable causes.  The food was really delicious, and they have a little shop with souvenirs as well if you'd like some amusing condom-themed stuff or even other things (spices, cookbooks, pashminas).  There's information there about other business they run and the work the profits support.  I definitely recommend going!

Great live music seven nights a week, Thai and international musicians, with shows starting at 7pm. Very friendly staff who will greet you warmly with a smile. Check Inn 99 is a historic bar whose location has changed over the years but it still retains that rare vibe that’s hard to find anymore in Bangkok in 2019. Totally worth checking out the jazz jam Sundays afternoons if you’re a musician and fan of music. It’s very casual and is family friendly — bring your kids to witness some spontaneous music happening up close! Their kitchen also serves Thai and international food (the steak was yummy!) and you can’t beat the 199 baht jugs of Asahi/Heineken/Chang draft beer! And they have a sports bar upstairs with a pool table!

Stumbled in at a late hour to grab a quick drink and something to bite with my girlfriend. 
Even though there wasn't too much going on any more, the atmosphere was chill and the manager organized us something to eat from the kitchen which was really tasty to our surprise. Staff was super friendly and quick as well. Can definitely recommend and would come back to check out when they have live music on.
All in all a really pleasant surprise!

Whether or not you like the place will depend a lot on the event that you attend there. Both time I went, it was to attend an event with empowered women, so.... yes I like it 😉 
They have a nice small performance space. Some nice options for finger foods, but the price for a bottle of water is quite high... drink beer...

I accidentally went there with my friend. It turned out to be very good. Nice ambience, and food. I went there a couple of times and the live music is good on some days. I love blues music and love the cotton mouth blues band that plays there occasionally.

Superb music, with different bands doing their own thing every night....can't go wrong here! Also, the prices are pretty damn reasonable for the music they serve up for you. I would say a definite Go Go Go......Go Johnny Go! 🤗

Extremely good Thai food at reasonable prices. 

The chrispy duck salad with cashew nuts is a must. The curries and duck are the specialty of the restaurant.
Amazing thai food!

전통있는 유명한 식당이다.
상도 받았던 것으로 기억한다.
음식의 양은 그리 많지 않다.
깔끔하게 음식이 나온다.
아쉽지만 가격은 조금 나간다. ^^
落ち着いて、タイ料理が楽しめます。数十年前から変わらない味が嬉しいですね。
雰囲気は良いですが、味は普通で値段高いです^^;

Good Buffet, good beef, good service. Everything improved compared to ten years ago as they have more competitors. The discount promotion they placed in front of the shop is misleading. So don't expect to get any discount then everything will be just fine.
Best place to get shabu shabu! I couldn’t stop eating everything! Worth the long wait 💯 Value for money 💯 Will definitely eat here again when I return to Bangkok!

Always one of my favourite buffet place with fine quality. They always have worthy promotion so follow their facebook page to keep yourself up to date. However, their sukiyaki soup can be too sweet once the soup started to dried up but you can always ask for refill.
My most favorite Japanese-style Suki-Shabu in Bangkok. This branch is original.
Good confort food, now newly renovated. Good value for the price.

Very diverse tastes and wonderfully presented food. This is a beautiful restaurant with an ambience that most cannot achieve.

This is a top of the line restaurant, dont leave Bangkok without going there.
The food really displayed Vietnamese must tries and the service was impeccable.  The design and atmosphere alone makes it well worth the visit.

From the first impressions we knew it was going to be good, the ambiance of the restaurant had a very nice cosy feel to it, I asked for a recommendation from the waiter he recommended a buffet for two, wow so much food that you could have had it for 4 people, we could not finish the buffet we were so full, the food was fantastic

Great Vietnamese restuarant with a delicious food and excellect service. The atmosphere is very relaxed with the soft light although it might seem a little bit formal when you first walk in. The staffs are very helpful with recommending the food even pouring the water. Another thing i like about this restuarant is the restroom! What a room, so large you could fit a tiny bed in (if you are a lady, check it out).
The best authentic Vietnamese food in Bangkok. Great ambience too. Value for money and great customer service.
Very good Japanese restaurant. Great food and loads of options, all very tasty.

This little place is hard to beat. The chirashi sushi lunch set was a generous portion, high in quality, including the rice, and very fair in price.  The side dishes were equally good.  The service was prompt and friendly. I will be back to try some of their other dishes.
Food Fresh and People friendly
Great food. Slightly pricey
Great quality of menu, excellent service. Highly Recommended.
New location. No customers. Poor service. Average food. High prices. Why bother? Can't even get anyone to get the bill, only 2 customers! Really rubbish, don't bother!
Nice place, good food and friendly staff
Good happy hour deal.
Excellent Food !
Really great atmosphere with good food. Sport easy to watch on TV and busy when Rugby matches are on.
Tasty food and not spicy. If you want them spicy, you tell the waiter. Staff is very friendly and sincere. Lamb, vegetables and rice was fine. We paid 60 euros at dinner for 2 people.

Loved it here. Its a bit tucked away from the main Street and probably wouldn't have found it myself if it wasn't for a recommendation, but I'm really happy that we did find it. We went in for a quick bite but I would be very happy to spend the evening here nibbling on different courses. The owner is very proud and the food really good.  Nicely spiced and the sides are fresh. Definitely visit.
Great food! Friendly guy running the place, with everything looking tidy and having a proper Indian atmosphere. It feels warm and welcome.
Really great place to eat! Very friendly staff/owner, food is delicious. Be carefully with hot or very hot, the hot was already really hot for me 😅.
The best Indian food after long time in europe. Try the Butter Chicken and lamb shahi korma with peswaria naan amazing tasty.
Best for Indians. Very good food. Loved it. This is the only best option for Indian food at sukhumvit. I was in sukhumvit for 4 days and ate the food in Indian Host.
Authentic Indian taste. Very friendly staff. Would highly recommend.
Food Quality good & reasonable price
Really yummy taste  i just loved that specially the achar And Dal tadka 😍❤

Order food with Food Panda it come after 2 hours then the food exactly was like left over possibly from other customers or maybe no food and what was left over send to me. The food was not eatable very bad. Also they are way over priced

The place is sweet and sober... Their food is super delicious.. totally loved it.. And it was perfectly plated.. Also the staff is very well behaved... Overall a perfect experience.. Definitely going on my frequent places list..

Very nice place to hangout with family and friends.Noticed this place while roaming around and looking for some decent place for lunch and I was not at all disappointed as I entered this restaurant. Ambience is amazing.Staff is also very good.The best part is that the restaurant has outdoor sitting as well and also very well managed. Now coming to the food,the menu offers you a lot of variety. Ordered both veg and non veg dishes and yes the food was really delicious. Last but not least price is really reasonable.Must try place while in Prayagraj.
Really nice ambience. Good service. Waitress was quick and had knowledge of the good food. Food is good. Quick service. A reasonable, pocket-friendly restaurant.

Good food. Combos are affordable.
 Location is friendly. Should visit after sunset to get a better view of the place.
One of the best place... One of the best thing is that it has both the cafe and restraunt.. loved the ambience and food.. price is budget friendly..
Best Indian Pakistani food in Bangkok! The owner is Pakistani and very creative. The servers are very attentive and the food is amazing!

Amazing and a very authentic Indian food in the heart of Bangkok. I was living in India for 3 years and I can say without a doubt that masala art provides true Indian taste. A lot of food to choose - suitable for vegans, vegetarians and non vegetarians. Very kind and polite staff providing a great service. 5*!

Poor service, raw food!
I visited the restaurant in the newly opened Icon Siam. Apart from one waiter, the service was hopeless! The first girl who served us didn’t know anything that was on the menu and couldn’t take our order. Our drinks never came and when we asked they told us the bar tender had gone home (at 21:00) when our food eventually came, the chicken in the butter chicken was completely raw! I showed the waitress and she took it away with little more than a shrug. 
However there was one guy who when we went to pay apologises profusely and took that dish off the bill and discounted us 20% off the entire bill
If the rest of the team were like him, I would be able to give this place a good review. Hopefully “opening night” jitters but I won’t be going back here anytime soon

One of the best Indian restaurants in Bangkok.  North Indian styled, delicious food but very expensive.
Biriyani is very special with a very good aroma and taste.  All foods are tasty. Visit here if you are searching for a Indian restaurant around bangkok
very nice restaurant , great manager , very friendly staff , reasonable price with great quality indian food.

Food is good but servings are not large considering the price. In similar places you get more for the money. The staff is nice. The location isn't great because you have to walk inside the local streets and dodge peddlers and vendors on the way in.

Must taste the food here once you there
Super service
And best taste food
May allah shower his blessings for serving halal food

Best Egyptian Resturant In Sukhumvit 
real Taste of Arabic Food.
Great food and inexpensive, although the place needs face uplift

Delicious food. Wide selection of all types of middle eastern dishes. I am usually apprehensive of a menu with too many cultural choices but this chef did a perfect job with everything we ordered. The lamb kebaabs and fatousch salad were the best ive ever had at a restaurant... and trust me i have high standards! Best pick of this entire area of mid east cuisine mixed into Bangkok.

It had to happen. .. I just ate here and it was terrible. I have eaten here many times and this was by far, THE worst experience and meal. I ordered pasta and seafood in squid sauce. The meal was swimming in squid sauce. It was disgusting. All the seafood was drowning in so much squid sauce I have no idea what kind of seafood was in there.
If you have eaten here, you know they start off by bringing crispy fried onions to the table. Today it was just a lump of onion strips swimming in grease. I had a beer, the meal, and a bottle of water and it was 875 Baht. I will NEVER eat here again. Tonight was absolutely disgusting.
Really good service to go with the carefully prepared and we'll made food. We were a big group but still everything was served at the right time. The home made pasta, pizza and mains all perfect?
Perfect as usual. This place has been the best place for pizza for a least the 15 years I've been going there. Many more places have arrived but none are better

We ordered a veg pizza with tomatoes, onions , fresh chillies.... as per the menu. 
But the chef put TABASCO sauce in the pizza !!!! 

Enough said...shocking!
The best pizza I've had in Bangkok.. you can't give this a miss.. Try the Mexicana if you want vegetarian!

Really lovely restaurant. Situated in the pullman hotel this place serves excellent food and a fine array of wine. The tapas is excellent and the waiter service is good. The pricing is reasonable and the quality of what you get is good. I would recommend asking for portion size as this varied for us and this can be challenging when sharing dishes. Overall would highly recommend.

Never Disappoints!! 
This place is great!  Food, service, atmosphere, everything is good.  The steak was perfect.  The meat paella is right on.  I've been there 3 times in the last 6 weeks!  Highly recommend giving it a go.

As mentioned, place is great, we feel relaxed when dining here.  Food is nice, there are 3 Tapas combos to offer, we chose 2, not bad, at least we can try more tapas , but seafood paella is slightly dry.  Service is friendly and attentive, which we enjoyed a lot.

Only dessert is just so so, cheese cake a too sweet and thick Chocolate cake is too plain, it will be better if serve with a Vanilla ice cream.

Very good quality of meat, well cooked and presented
Not cheap but you get what you pay for
Food are really good and the service are great as well, will definitely come back again when I visit Bangkok next time.

Really good Mexican fare in a well appointed, comfortable space.  The corn chips are great and made specifically for Charley's (they are not the commercially sourced chips that you get everywhere else).  All of the basic menu items, salsa, guac, beans, rice, enchiladas etc. are very good and the margaritas are well worth ordering.  You could do well just ordering chips, salsa, guacamole and a pitcher of Margaritas!
Recommended.
Excellent Mexican food in Thailand... Who knew? Lol! Ate here several times, tried something different each time. It was delicious each time! Close to hotel. Nice restaurant...try it!

Bachata on Mondays (a Latin dance lesson and social) is a great event.  Definitely recommend going there for that.  Can't say about the food, eating local food is so much cheaper, but all foreign foods are expensive in Thailand.

I recently tried the food and have to recant. I had an excellent experience. The food gave me powerful memories of eating Mexican food back home. What can I say? They made a believer out of me. Oh and I would love to see someone beat the hell out of Donald Trump...a Donald Trump piñata that is.

First time for me for trying Mexican food in restaurant. My American friend invited me to visit there.  The owner is so friendly and kind. The restaurant is awesome with the light and music. Food are amazing and awesome.  If you want to try real Mexican food, you should visit here.

Service is atrocious here. Even though the food is pretty good and the venue has the potential to a great place for large group gatherings. Out side are is also a mosquito haven. If you are going to get food here I suggest take away!
Great food! I mean really great food! It's a little out of the way and the service we had on our one visit wasn't great but would eat there again.
So so.. Not great food and the place is dilapidated.. Plenty of better eating options in the area - save your time and money
A great choice for American style barbecue especially ribs. When you're missing comfort food go here. Even on the American holidays.
Overpriced, not super clean but food delicious.

-Easy to park
-hotel is nicely maintained than any hotel I went before
-great Indian restaurant on their 26 floor with live music. Best Indian food I've ever eat!. Service is good, waiter explain each item and asked politely if you want or don't want to try. A true hospitality.
Place: Great place for birthday party.  Everybody joined enjoy the place from 7 Indian Girl to 82 years old Swedish grandma ;)

Nice hotel rooms, especially for a large group! A group of 6 stayed in the two bedroom apartment suite and we appreciated how large and comfy the rooms were. The staff was so friendly and knowledgeable of the surrounding area. All of the amenities like the pool, gym, and shuttle service was good. The only thing that was a problem was the water temperature in the shower: it would either be too hot or too cold and we couldn't fix it. We moved to a different room and it seemed to be fixed.

Good hotel, great location. Walking distance from Terminal 21 mall and Soi Cowboy. nice pool, great food options inside. Only gripe I have is how small the executive club room was. Even with the breakfast or happy hour, It was not worth the nearly double nightly fare compared to the other room options. I would stay here again, just in a regular or even try the family room next time.

Despite first impressions this hotel is very well positioned for Bangkok sight seeing. A few minutes walk gets you to a sky train or an underground station. With these and a ferry or two you can access most of the popular sights. The hotel itself is very friendly and comfortable and the breakfasts are very good.  Recommended.

My stay in your hotel was as I wished and expected. The location was convenient: close to convention centre, skytrain and metro. The quality and availability of the services met my expectations, and the value for money was very good. The  personnel was also professional. All in all, I don't find any specific points for improvement. Instead I would like to send a special greetings to your breakfast team: very efficient work!

Visited this restaurant several times and I never felt disappointed. Food is great and I love the green tea rice they serve in particular. Their waitresses are very professional and friendly. Highly recommended.

I didn't have great expectations as this is a restaurant in a hotel catering to business travelers whom one can serve almost anything provided the place is closer to their room or computer. But I found a really nice Thai food selection, beautifully and eloquently described by the server, a good selection of wine by the glass and a great hospitality.
Soooo niiicceee ! Thanks Sumit. Congrats and thanks for your hospitality. We will be back for sure

One of the best fine dining thai restaurants at a convenient location at Sheraton Grande Sukhumvit next to Asoke BTS station. We let the waiter help us organize dishes for 4 to share. They serve 3 tyoes of rice, pandan rice, brown rice and plain white rice.
Great ambiance. Lovely staff and pretty decent selection of vegan options. Not as much as vegan restaurants but good if you're going out with omnivores.
Beautiful restaurant, amazing food!
Delicious food
Remember this place from more than 20 years ago. Always loved going here even as a child. Must go back!!
The ambience is great, but the food is ok, not so much level of surprise. The lunch is reasonable and recommended.
Tasty food. Ravioli must try. Very yummy. Nice ambience.
Nice Italian restaurant.  Up to the standards.
Fine dine Italian cuisine, this restaurant is over 30 years, win many awards. Romantic atmosphere in the restaurant section. The pizzaria and wine bar section more relax.

I had one of the best dining experiences of my life at Le Beaulieu last night! I first heard about this fine French restaurant from friends and yesterday's dinner certainly did not disappoint. Le Beaulieu's classy interior is only surpassed by the excellent quality and taste of its food, prepared in such a way that does not only satisfy your gastronomic craving for French cuisine but also inspires the foodie in you. Definitely a must-see, must-visit, must-try when in Bangkok!
Fantastic food, service & ambiance! The first address on my list each time I visit the Thai capital. Highly recommended!
Outstanding French restaurant. Simply delicious!
My favourite French restaurant in Bangkok
Delicious

Rang Mahal is one of the oldest Indian restaurant in Bangkok. The food over the years have gone down in both quality and quantity. The atmosphere of the restaurant has been the same since 12 years. Service of the restaurant is average and not as high as a fine restaurant should have. The new menu change has reduced the vegetarian options. The restaurant needs renovations and needs to redesign the menu for both Vegetarians and Non Vegetarians.

Quality of food top notch. Options are less though
 Ambience soothing and classy. We requested for a small cake for my father's bday and they made a superb arrangement.

Lovely restaurant with a great menu. Staff are superb and service is excellent. What I really like is the roof bar which is straight next to the restaurant, means that you can have drinks before and after.
Top place all round.
Thanks for the experience.

We had an amazing dinner here with friends just before the sun was setting. The set menus are excellent value and will definitely fill you up. The staff are courteous and polite. The chef even prepared everyone at the table some tasters from particular parts of our starter meal we all enjoyed. The view is spectacular as well. Whilst the sun was setting you can watch the colours of Bangkok transform. On the pricier side for Bangkok food but totally worth it.
View from restaurant is fantastic and food is decent. But extremely expensive. Sara's is close by and is a lot better.
Always a treat to visit bully's. Good music, never too loud. Sports on TV if you're interested. Nice booths for groups. Menu is pricey, but exceptional. Drinks are varied and good.
Absolutely great service. Good food prepared well. Management pays a lot of attention to cleanliness. This place has been getting better over the years. Pricing is well within affordable range
Nice place. Around the corner from SOI 4. Not quite as loud and crazy as the other bars by Nana Plaza. Good food. Everything from Pad Thai to burgers and fajitas.
Good, long standing pub. Good menu and choice of drinks including Guinness. Pool tables, sports on TV reasonably priced

Editing review for clarity. I had fish and chips, my husband had a pulled pork burger. The fish and chips was cold in the middle even though it was deep fried, so it clearly came straight from the freezer. My husband's food was just inedible. The meat tasted rotten. We both tried it, there was something very wrong. He didn't touch it yet when the waitress took it away neither she nor the kitchen asked if there was something wrong. We paid and left without finishing anything. 

I'm sure your bar is a popular spot at night for the boys in Nana, but it is not a place to go for a meal.
Remember this place from more than 20 years ago. Always loved going here even as a child. Must go back!!
The ambience is great, but the food is ok, not so much level of surprise. The lunch is reasonable and recommended.
Tasty food. Ravioli must try. Very yummy. Nice ambience.
Nice Italian restaurant.  Up to the standards.
Fine dine Italian cuisine, this restaurant is over 30 years, win many awards. Romantic atmosphere in the restaurant section. The pizzaria and wine bar section more relax.

Great live music seven nights a week, Thai and international musicians, with shows starting at 7pm. Very friendly staff who will greet you warmly with a smile. Check Inn 99 is a historic bar whose location has changed over the years but it still retains that rare vibe that’s hard to find anymore in Bangkok in 2019. Totally worth checking out the jazz jam Sundays afternoons if you’re a musician and fan of music. It’s very casual and is family friendly — bring your kids to witness some spontaneous music happening up close! Their kitchen also serves Thai and international food (the steak was yummy!) and you can’t beat the 199 baht jugs of Asahi/Heineken/Chang draft beer! And they have a sports bar upstairs with a pool table!

Stumbled in at a late hour to grab a quick drink and something to bite with my girlfriend. 
Even though there wasn't too much going on any more, the atmosphere was chill and the manager organized us something to eat from the kitchen which was really tasty to our surprise. Staff was super friendly and quick as well. Can definitely recommend and would come back to check out when they have live music on.
All in all a really pleasant surprise!

Whether or not you like the place will depend a lot on the event that you attend there. Both time I went, it was to attend an event with empowered women, so.... yes I like it 😉 
They have a nice small performance space. Some nice options for finger foods, but the price for a bottle of water is quite high... drink beer...

I accidentally went there with my friend. It turned out to be very good. Nice ambience, and food. I went there a couple of times and the live music is good on some days. I love blues music and love the cotton mouth blues band that plays there occasionally.

Superb music, with different bands doing their own thing every night....can't go wrong here! Also, the prices are pretty damn reasonable for the music they serve up for you. I would say a definite Go Go Go......Go Johnny Go! 🤗

Another stunning temple that seems to have been left off of the tourist map. It’s not difficult to get to, either a tuktuk or boat ride across the river and you can enjoy the site at your leisure because it’s not swamped by tourists. Amazing, GIANT statue of a sitting Buddha as well as a smaller monument to Gandhi.

my visit was very interesting. I was asked to visit the primary school attached to the Wat. It is similar to 80% of Thai schools; poor. Kids were wonderful and eager to learn. If you are in the area spend money there. So many tourists base the authenticity of their Thailand adventures on places like this. But dont give back to the community
 When you visit make a habit to buy something in these communities. Even if is just a bottle of water.

Wonderful temple. But we used the location to enter the khlong system, canals. The long-tailed boat trip was brilliant and worth the 350 baht each, sharing a boat will cost you even less and you don't have to talk to the other occupants. Great wildlife too, please buy a chaing beer from the old dear on the boat shop, it's a tad expensive but keeps that way of life going. Someone should really put a visitor tax on the canals or pressure on those with the powers of control, the canals need cleaning up and restoring, save the Bangkok canals, cripes sorry for that I got on my orange box for a moment there, I will refrain from having such outbursts in the future.

The Buddhist temple famous for the large Buddha statue in seated posture. Just 20 minutes away by walking from the temple of dawn (Wat Arun), it is known locally as ‘Wat Samporkong’ or the temple with large Buddha statue. It’s very famous among the Chinese. The easiest way to get there is by boat (cost 6 Bht) from Atsadang pier close to Yodpiman shopping village. Note that the pier opens at 6am and closes at 8pm. Very interesting to go and explore if visiting Wat Arun is not enough for you.
There is  a sacred Buddha which Thai and Chinese peple will come to pay restpect in chinese new year, Song Kran festival.

This buddhist temple is frequented mostly by local thais. Not many tourist here. Its situated next to the Chao Praya river. You can take the river ferry to Tha Chang stop or Prannok Pier. Seldom any tourist here. This buddhist temple has a very serene and peaceful atmosphere. The temple architecture is utterly beautiful in design and style. A very nice place to visit. If you can stay for the sunset would be the best as you can look opposite the river and watch the sun setting over the Bangkok skyline. As a buddhist, if you do have time, do pay this temple a visit. Pay your respects and make a wish. Hopefully, it maybe a blessing in disguise 😁😁🙏🙏🙏

Citizen Kane is a good film because it effectively uses film language on many different levels. The camera work and lighting are so meticulous that with each viewing there is more to see and appreciate. The way the film is laid out also sets it apart. The beginning of the film is actually the ending of the story because in the opening scene the main character, Kane utters the last words of "rosebud" and then dies. This sets the stage for the retelling of his life and the search for the mysterious origins of "rosebud". In Citizen Kane it is really the small things that make the film so effective. A good scene that illustrates this point is in the beginning when young Kane is playing outside his house and his parents are talking about what is going to happen to him. As his parents talk they are the focus of the shot and are in the foreground but in the background framed through a window we can see young Kane playing out in the snow. This type of shot is used later in the film when Kane throws a party for his newspaper. Leland and Mr. Burnstein are talking about Kane and we see a reflection of him dancing in a window, framed almost the same as the shot when he was a child. This film also uses low angle shots quite often which make the characters seem larger than life. These low angle shots are most noticeable when Kane is first starting out as an adult and after he loses the election. Mise-en-scene is also an essential element of this film. In the scene where Leland is passed out on his typewriter the bottle of alcohol is placed prominently in the frame, this type of shot is repeated when Susan O.D.'s and the sedative is placed in the close foreground of the shot. The use of focus in Citizen Kane gives the viewer insight into what the characters are thinking or feeling. Often throughout the film when Kane is talking business he will go out of focus and only Leland will be in sharp focus. It is in these types of shots that we see that Leland is thinking about the man that he once knew which ultimately foreshadows the falling out they will have toward the end of the film. The last thing that I will mention that this film does very well is the use of transitions. For instance when Kane is looking at the picture of the Chronicle employees and it transitions from the picture to the actual people who are then employed by Kane. Also, when the newspapers run the article of Kane and Susan's affair it transitions from her building door with the 185 over it to the same shot on the cover of the newspaper. The use of a slow fade is also used throughout the film when ever a character is remembering. Needless to say, I think that Citizen Kane is a very

Expect lots of pigeons and touting locals once you get off the ferry.
But once inside, all is peaceful and forgotten.

Discovered this temple while looking for the ferry crossing back to the other side of Chao Praya River. The temple is very popular with Chinese and Thai's with many tourists boats stopping, since I wasn't dressed to enter the temple I only saw the out. It's nice and like many Buddhist Temples throughout Bangkok. It's easy to get to from the Grand Palace stop and a short ferry ride across the river.
Very respectful temple and have good locetion with river view can go by boat.
很多人踢球
很多人踢球
Difficult to travel here. Good and interesting exhibition.
Good Library to read.
Great library.
เคยไปดู โขน ลิเก ละคร หลายครั้ง ตอนนี้กำลังจะมีแสดงงิ้ว (เราโพสตอนนี้ วันที่ 29/1/61 งิ้วจะมีวันที่ 5/1/61)
สะอาด เงียบ เป็นศูนย์กลางการเรียนรู้และการศึกษา หลายๆด้าน

Limited English translations however this only slightly detracted from the experience as there were audio assisted headphones available at the desk.
Not for the faint of heart or children as it is visually rather traumatic and gruesome, however it is incredibly interesting and the best way to source information on forensic matters.
I would highly recommend taking the challenge to find this museum and attend as the locals are very friendly and ready to assist, and if it interests you then the pay off is well worth it.

Very cool collection, worth a stop for sure! This place really is great and pack full of oddities. The anatomy building is really where it’s at for me, such a wild collection packed so densely. 200 baht, for 300 you get access to the history museum near the river as well, very worth the price.

If you have a strong stomach or an interest in forensic or medical science this is the place for you! Was a little tricky to find as it's within many buildings but the locals are very friendly and helpful and the museum provides maps on arrival. 5 museums to look at with different themes for each - there's not alot of English translations but if your wanting a look around at some interesting things a couple of hours here would be well worth it! 200 baht p/p (no photos allowed though)
Nothing like this place.  You’ll feel exhausted by the end and it’s not for the faint of heart, but a truly fascinating museum.
Excellent museum, visited on a hop-on hop-off  boat tour. Fascinating history, very well presented
Nice monument in a weird location

This is a really cool monument, and a great inner-city park. They have two jogging paths inside, a big one and a little one. There's a under the road stairway so that you can get across safely, and there are sky bridges so you can walk to it from any direction on the roundabout without running into traffic. It's nice and peaceful and serene inside the park, despite it being one of Bangkok's busiest roundabouts. Definitely worth visiting.
The great statue is at the center of the roundabout.  Be careful when crossing the street. That after You can take picture safety with choicing best points from 360 degree.
Nothing much to see here
Very busy roundabout

reviews.author_name: สัน ดุสิต
reviews.text: Oh that very very​good​ of tecture​ dellicious and​ true​ southfood​ of​ thailand.
Beef kuay kring is good . Not expensive  and big portion. Spicy Mixed vegetables and rice is suitable for being a side dish.
Crazily tasty and spicy!! Great selection and nice picture containing menu. Great mark weins suggestion!
Good southern style food around this area.

The restaurant has a lot of foods and open even on Sunday. I ordered fish entrail curry and sour curry with taco stems, they are really spicy. If it's less salty, it will be perfect. The spacr is fairly humid, small and old. Btw, on the way to the phanok piers, there are so much street foods on one side, you may eat less in Ruam Tai and grab other street foods.
Great riverside location for food and dinner cruise at reasonable prices. Now new location at Tha Din Dang.

Been to many dinner cruises on Chao Phraya river Bangkok. This is one of my favourite. It’s non luxurious nor pretentious. You pay ฿200 per person for the cruise and all the drinks and food are a-la-carte on menu. Very authentic Thai food and western food is available too. Reasonable priced. A bottle red wine ฿600-1,400. Steam whole sea bass ฿390, crab meat curry ฿160. New and big boat with totally open top deck, lots of tables and seats to choose. Not many tourists but quite popular with the locals. Note, there’s a Yok Yor restaurant 2 blocks away which is not the boarding place for cruise. Yok Yor Marina & Restaurant is the boarding place for dinner cruise. 
There’s a live band singing jazzy and soothing English, Thai and Chinese songs. Not like some other boats blasting with loud party music if you want some relaxing atmosphere.
Definitely will return whenever in Bangkok. :)
Good food and good service..

Yok Yor Marina & Restaurant (non buffet cruise)

I am of mixed reviews about the restaurants dinner cruise. My wife and i went there this evening with our 9 month daughter and my mother. We started with drinks in the restaurant while we waited to board the boat. The waitress was fantastic she was interacting with our daughter and looked after us really well however when we went to board the boat she was busy with another table the wait staff from the boat didnt come as assist us to board and we had to carry our own drinks, pram, baby bag onto the boat our selves. My wife had to ask the waiter watching us struggle to help carry the drinks.

My wife ordered a steamed rice for our daughter and when it arrived at the table it was cold and sick, the smell is that of rice that is off ข้าวบูด. We sent it back for a fresh serve. 

The food however yummy was let down by the wait staff. I am ashamed to say that out of all of the Asian countries I have visited this was the worst customer service that I have ever experienced. I was pouring my own drinks which I don't have an issue with however the table next to us was getting table service. We had to request to have the drinks refilled. the dirty dinner plates were left on the table and I carried the pram up the stairs and I attempted to carry it again down the stairs before the manager finally saw me and asked someone to assist me.

Food 4/5
Views 5/5
Customer service -2/5
Two hours dinner on boat, u must try the food with good taste and price reasonable

Great place and a great way to show the people kindness. They are giving you vegetarian food for free that is simple but really delicious 😋!!!  The place is really clean and there you can see all kind of different types of people and no one is judging them about anything just accepting them and share with them the food as a act of kindness!

A very interesting and friendly place. Be welcomed into a vibrant religious community in the heart of Bangkok. Free food served at times I don't know. Enjoy the chanting and witness interesting and wonderous religious services. Be respectful. You're a guest.

One of the few temples for Sikh worshippers and devotees in Bangkok. If you are non-Sikh, please ask for a yellow cloth on the ground floor to wear as head wrap to be able to enter the place. The monk chant starts early morning every day and takes place on the 4th floor. They also provide free vegetarian food on the 2nd floor. Please make some donation to support the temple’s religious activities.

Must visit place and great atmosphere build by all the sevadaars. 
Langar timings morning 9-11 Monday to Saturdays

Amazing. I didn't know the gurdwara so close to my hostel so I visited it on new years day. The nearest station is ratchathewi so from that bts station you'll need a cab. Make sure you put the meter on. It should take you only 100 baht. Make sure your driver has the address. The gurdwara is large and beautiful. Very clean. The sangat is nice. I'm going to visit again in three weeks.

Beautiful temple Wat Emerald Temple The royal monastery is in the center of the city. Neighborhood Not far from Yaowarat Road. Thai-Chinese border The business district, however, to this day.

People are not aware that many people know the temple was famous in Thailand, but before the present era is a true bestseller.
 
It is a special one. The temple is full of joy.

This temple is beautiful to look like a temple.
Architecture in the Khmer era. Inside the temple is a painting by a painter. Tells the story of the goddess Vessel.
 
There are many things in the temple to praise you. The temple is in the business district. You have no car parked enough in this temple, but .... Free parking is not in the world and then. Everything for money in religious affairs. I think it's a good idea.
There were two baby crocs that were sleeping mid day. There is so e decent swag to see. Worth a visit if you are in the area.
One of my favorite places during my visit in Bangkok. I could observe monks chanting and praying inside. A must see!
Very calm and enlightening place. See the crocodiles!
The temple was closed when I got there but the lonely crocodile looked pretty miserable in such a tiny enclosure
Calm Thai temple in China Town
Peaceful temple surrounded by many statue, inside is very beautiful.
This place is well known for having a number of monks who has Horoscope knowledge. The place itself is very peaceful too.
Quiet and not visited much but very nice
Nice quite temple.  Free entry

One of the best places in Thailand to find peace and serenity, Also if you are planning to come during the Summers do wear socks as the floor on top of the temple gets heated up a lot during the season...
There is a provision for the Elevator as well in case any person doesn't plan on going up the stairs due to any reason...
The Gold statue of the Buddha simply leaves people astonished due to its beauty...

A very impressive golden Budha statue placed in a beautiful temple near China Town. A must see place in Bangkok. Better to read history rather than hiring a tour guide. There is an entry fee and a dress code; no shorts or sleeveless. Better to visit early in the morning to avoid rush. Photography is allowed inside the temple. Overall a good experience.

Situated next to the Bangkok Chinatown gate, many tour buses bring lots of tourists here. We were there on December 26 and it was crowded in the morning. Stalls surrounding the temple sell souvenirs as well as various Buddhist items. The ticket booth servers as the visitor information. One museum shows the history of the Golden Buddha statue and the temple building, the other about Chinatown. You can get drinks and food in the canteen. Shoes off when you enter the temple. They rent scarfs so that 
exposed shoulders can be covered up when entering the temple.

An absolutely stunning temple that reaches into the sky. A small entry fee of about 50THB and it’s definitely on the tour bus agenda so make sure you get here early in the morning to avoid the masses. The first level also contains a compact museum and nice views from the top level of the surrounding area.

Amazing work of art. We are not Buddhists but you have to admire the beautiful mother of pearl inlaid into the toes and the soles of the feet. Interesting to see the faithful depositing one small coin into each of dozens of pots in a row.

Beautiful architecture, one of the many Thai Chinese clan associations in Bangkok. The temple of the premise is for the worship of Martial God Guan Yu, representing and managed by the Cantonese speaking community
While most Thais have Theowcho ancestors this is a rather different place as it has Cantonese roots
Good ancestral hall in Thailand ! I now know Sae was forced to be added to my last name and it is originally Cheung and my ancestors are from Guangdong !

เป็นโรงพยาบาลดูแลผู้สูงอายุที่โรงพยาบาลอื่นส่งต่อมาให้  มีผู้ป่วยในที่ไม่มีปัจจัยชำระเงินค่ารักษาพยาบาล  สถานที่ตั้งอยู่ใกล้ตลาดเก่า China Town อนาคตมีรถไฟใต้ดินเปิดบริการ  สถานีวัดมังกร MRT อยู่ฝั่งตรง
Templo chino.

Initially my colleague intro me to this temple for donation & pray..
Till now, everytime i come bkk, i never fail to visit this temple for my prayers.. you guys also pls come here to donate & help the needy in rural areas.. thank you
Good place in Yowarat to donate Coffin money to make merits. Drop at Hua Lamphong MRT and take a cab or tuk tuk there. It is next to the police station.

Amitabha !! For those who got extra money in their pocket can donate to them because this organisation is to help the poor by donating rice , food and even coffin to helpless family . 

Its a franchise and founded in china . Now in bangkok . Located in china town and there is 2 places to donate , one is just beside police station where vendor selling incense and praying material (looks like a carpark when go in) and the other one is just opposite . They have a very old temple there and stories written on the wall . So spend some time there and hopefully those who can afford kindly donate . Is a merit for us and most importantly can help the needy . 🙏🙏🙏🙏🙏
Very good place to make a donation. Authorized public charity foundation by thai-chinese.
Another place to make a merit.

very beautiful church next to the river. i came here in the evening at 3-4pm. there is no light on inside the church. the window glass is more visible to catch the shot. very beautiful scene. i love the story on the window and wall and the statue of the Angel and Jesus.

Very peaceful, nice architecture, worth a stop and look anytime you are in the area. Closest Ferry stop is Marine. There are some nice cafes in the area too. For pictures visit my Instagram, Wildalaskaken_official.
Nice​ place, beautiful​ architecture.​ But​ it​ is​ in​ the​ grounds  of​ a​ school​ so​ I​ couldn't​ get​ inside.​ The​ local​ area​ has​ good​ food​ and​ a​ nice​ vibe
Beautiful church beside Chao Phraya river, worth coming if you intend to visit Talat Noi.
Beautiful church.  Can take a taxi boat to get there.

That was my. First time to go.

If you have a car, i recommend ya go there in the morning.

For the traditional clothes n fabrics, here is the best place to look around.
Siam (Thai) contemporary themed shopping mall, locating in the old town area. Inside you can enjoy traditional Thai sweets (the taste is not overly sweet), Thai silk, and other Thai products.
Perfect place to get some traditional Thai clothes/food/desserts/etc. if you’re nearby, this is the place worth visiting.
old style shopping mall in Bangkok! if you want to see local people, local shopping and local food. you can come here!
Variety of elegant choices. Ready-made silk dresses with options of being fixed for those with mid-sizes.

Deep fried Grouper with hot spicy sauce was good. The fish was cooked perfectly crispy. The sauce was sweet but not spicy at all, which was disappointing. 

Hot & Sour Seafood Soup (tom yum). From the menu description I expected a Chinese hot and sour soup, that is not what you get.  The tom yum had a good balance of all the expected flavors   Not as salty as most tom yum versions.  Plenty of seafood. 

Duck Tongue was crispy and much larger and meatier than other places. 

This meal with water cost 1,160 baht

Popular place in Bangkok's Chinatown were we stopped for lunch. The place was full and although there was a waiting time we were seated almost immediately. The place is huge inside and the food was good but nothing amazing. Thank you to the nice couple that helped us get the extra sauces and with sauce to use in each dish

I really don't understand how this restaurant is rated so high by so many people. First of all the menu is a mess. This was the first time I got tired of reading a restaurant menu. The food was fine, around 3/5. The service is quite bad, the waiters throw the dishes on the table. They don't know English at all. I was asking if my dish includes a rice, the waitress said it does. I wasn't surprised when we got the bill and saw the extra rice in it. And for the finale, they include the waiters service in the bill (around 20 bats per person). Ofc we paid it, but they don't deserve it at all. At all..

It’s rare to enjoy a Thai-style soup that is not heavily salted. The prawn noodles and shark fin soup were near perfection. The place gets packed so large groups beware.  The menu is deep but the staff offer tasty recommendations.
Very very delicious with fair price. If you love Chinese food. This restaurant I would like to recommend.

Very good service. The brown soup is tasty and be served in boiling. Spring Roll is not crispy as it said Hong Kong style (never try original one) but all good to dip with plum sauce. I treated my Japanese friend here and she really enjoy everything.
Overpriced food. Not really good. Among the worst quality/price I have seen. Don’t take Amex.
Sea food.. Sea food and only sea food there.. And still there u have to stand in Que to eat as rush is always there rates are fare and mostly eateries are there

Overpriced and not really good food. Peking duck was dry and full of bones. It was definitely not worth 1000 THB for a portion. The restaurant is fancy and rather posh. Prices are high and do not correspond with quality or expectations. There is Wi-Fi here. You can pay with credit card.
Jazz. Beer. Drinks. Good place and atmosphere.

Deep fried Grouper with hot spicy sauce was good. The fish was cooked perfectly crispy. The sauce was sweet but not spicy at all, which was disappointing.

Duck Tongue was crispy and much larger and meatier than other places.

Very very delicious with fair price. If you love Chinese food. This restaurant I would like to recommend.
Authentic Indian food at a very reasonable price. We had ordered mutter paneer, tandoori roti and rice. Quantity was enough for 2 people and taste was as Indian as possible in Bangkok.
Nice Indian restaurant to try with. The taste was authentic, packed with Indian customers. The price was reasonable. No car park available.
One of the best authentic indian food in Bangkok. Good food and service.
Best North Indian dishes without making holes in your pocket with hospitality of rural India! A must visit place in Bangkok for Indian food lovers.
I have ordered a set of non veg dish. Curry is great but the grilled chicken was improper cooked. It was liquid blood out of the bone (at first I thought it is sauce). Price is a bit high.

Great place in China Town. Foods and services are excellent as always. Have been coming here for many years, highly recommended to anyone who is especially enjoyed the Chinese food. It's a must if you visit Bangkok.

Great chineese food. A bit on the expensive side but worth the money. Come with a group of people to really enjoy variety of food there. Portion are pretty big so come in group of 10 to really enjoy the place. All the seafood are top quality fresh and tasety.
Very good taste of food but price is a bit high. Parking is easy on elevator parking building beside.
One of the best Chinese restaurants in Bangkok China town. The seafood dishes are highly recommended because of the fresh and size of fishes, crabs and prawns.

Amazing food. Typical thai food and the Fish is amazing. Would strongly recommend the fish and the glass noodles with crab. Morning glory was pretty decent as well but I would definitely go for the fish. I cannot emphaisze how nice the Fish is. A must try when you head down to Tang Jai Yoo.
